description: One of the best dive bars in my opinion, bartenders are friendly and speedy, prices are reasonable, the atmosphere it's a mix of pos work and locals from the neighborhood, one of the few bars in the area the offers a smoke area indoors without the need to go outside and a pool table in the end that always sparks some friendly and fun vibe to your night
author: Rubens T.

description: Interesting little spot. Couldn't complain about the drinks and service was good! Stopped in on a whim and want disappointed.
author: Monique H.

description: We randomly chose this bar to meet at as a pre-dinner spot - at 8pm on a Friday just missing their happy hour, this spot was busy and it was hard to find a spot to sit right away. I had The Rose, which was a nice summer drink, super light and refreshing, and even for it not being happy hour, very well-priced! I think the total for 3 drinks came to ~$34 before tip. Music playlist was fun and dance worthy, and the pool table in the back was in constant use! They also allow dogs, so we got to meet a few cuties as we hung out there! Great location to be near to some good food places and bars, and such a generous happy hour of 2pm-8pm that I'll know I'll be back!
author: Marites S.

description:
We saw this place while walking around earlier in the day and thought it looked pretty cool. So, after dinner we walked around a little more, took uber back to the hotel and decided to come check this place out.

It has a really cool atmosphere to it from the wood flooring to the fireplace to the red lights behind the bar. Even the bar itself has a really nice patina to the wood. Smoking is only permitted in a small designated area. It did not smell of smoke inside. 

They have a happy hour from 4pm to 8pm every day with $4.50 draft beers, discounts on well drinks and specialty cocktails which are featured on the boards behind the bar. I ordered an Elysian Space Dust IPA on tap and my wife ordered a Pomegranate Margarita. Both of which were very good. The service was very friendly and efficient.

We sat for a while and reminisced about the days events before heading back to the hotel for the night. 

This is my kind of bar to hang out. Cheers!
author: Mike B.

description: I'm all for a good dive bar but...... the bartender on Monday 5/21/18 at 530p was taking shots with customers and not taking our order. When she finally came by, she didn't know what was on tap. Couldn't identify the beers and when asked "what is the Faction that you have on tap", she couldn't identify it and then said "you wouldn't want it anyway." My friend had 2 mixed drinks which he said were so-so / a little weak. Loved the décor, space is cool but the bartender needs to step up her game. If you want to drink on the job, that's ok if you're doing your job!
author: Kevin K.

description:
Bacchus Kirk has quickly become one of my favorite neighborhood hang outs. 

The drinks are good, and the service is even better. Rebecca is not only a fast and efficient bartender, but really has a special way of making everyone feel welcome and taken care of. I never feel snubbed or like she doesn't have time for me, even when she has a full bar. 

You can bring food in, and there's a pool table. A fun spot to imbibe at.
author: Liane V.

description:
Very red inside and a decent place to go after work. 

We ordered the drink specials where you get a shot + beer or a well drink for only 6.50!

The bartenders were nice but I don't like dive bars too much so I thought the venue was alright.
author: Brianne I.

description:
After taking a brief survey of the reviews written about Bacchus Kirk, I can definitely tell you that this will not be the worst review you will read.  Ai yah.  This is a terrific neighborhood bar for this particular neighborhood, which is Nob Hill.  Some would label it Lower Nob Hill, some would even go Tendernob.  People who call this the Tendernob are clueless.  

Bacchus Kirk is totally legit from a neighborhood bar standpoint.  Great mix of taps.  Cool local patrons.  Good Happy Hour.  And, I won't lie, I am not a huge cigarette smoker, but I know some people who can't go ten minutes without a smoke in their hand, and this place has the smoking porch.  They have a fireplace and a pool table, and it is always comfortable. 

You will find this a place with a terrific bar that plays a lot of roles.  It's local-oriented, but this is an area where a lot of transplants end up.  The bar opens early and the Happy Hour is deep.  It got a bit more expensive lately, but I will attest to a $4.50 solid Draft Beer list.  

The people who come here are solid.  It's not fratty/douchy like some places.  It's full of pretty smart folks.  They have good bartenders from my experience.
author: Adam S.

description: My late night spot! But also, my potential daytime spot that feels like late night. This is my local dive bar and I love this place. It is not gimmicky or pretentious (as SF dive bars are want to be sometimes) and the bartenders are the best.
author: Lei T.

description: Great little neighborhood spot! The drinks are strong. The crowd is not too crazy on a weekday night either.
author: Leila H.

description: My Indian American friend was called the N word by a bro tonight. When he confronted the bro about it they were both thrown out of the bar. The staff clearly did not have his back in the matter when they should have. Appalling that they don't seem to have an issue with this kind of behavior. I'm disappointed that this happened in a city like SF! I would not go to this bar period based on their attitude about this kind of behavior. No thanks.
author: Marian C.

description: Love this place! If you're from out of town and want a local vibe with great service, selection and prices this is the place.
author: Denny S.

description: Best bar in the Tender Nob. Had some great times in my early 30's in that joint. Cool fireplace and (may be gone now) a smoking room where we had some memorable conversations.
author: Steve B.

description:
-Fireplace
-Juke Box
-Cheap Drinks
-My kinda place! 

Found this spot after a show one night while waiting for traffic to die down.  Pleasantly surprised.  The guy at the door was cool and welcoming. Friendly and  informative bartender,  fun lil' dive!  

Check it out!
author: Dee C.

description: i recently had a bad experience at this place. i live in the area, and park on the street. there was an open spot in front of baacus kirk, as i attempted to park 2 patrons from this bar came out and offered to move the scooter that was parked on the street, to allow more room. they insisted on asking for $20. when i refused to pay, they retreated back into the bar. very soon another person, a lady, came out from this bar and offered the previous 2 guys would reposition the same scooter for 2 beers. I lived on this street for 10 years and have never experienced any hustle like this. This bar clearly is attracting a very a very bad clientele, be careful of this place. if my experience happened outside in the full light of day, god only knows the "hustle" that is going inside.
author: Cornelious W.

description: Awesome place for a drink. Good tap selection, great ambience, and music is not so loud that you can't have a conversation.
author: J W.

description: Jackie, you the best. Specific drink request, delivery of the drinks on point. .  Only reason i gave it a 4. I had to walk up one more hill.
author: K B.

description: Hands down the best marg in town.  Spicy but not mouth on fire.  Friendly bartender, a pool table, and a relaxed vibe.
author: Alex E.

description: My buddies and I were looking for a bar to play pool at before one of them had dinner plans in the area. We initially went to golden gate taproom and immediately regretted this decision. That place seriously sucks..... Searching for other bars in the area we came across Bacchus Kirk. I fell in love with the Scottish? bartender, She is super cute and her accent makes you feel so welcomed and loved.
author: Dave M.

description: Might've been a 3 or a 5 star. Few drinks in so I'm not sure. I left a credit card and they promptly texted me and I was able to pay close it up. Edits they opened. Thanks folks!
author: Eric D.

description: 'A very chill bar' as it was recommended to me. Chill bar, indeed. Nice hangout. Laid back. Great beer selection, about 12 taps. Killer tunes. Bartender Kitty the coolest and absolutely as hot and sexy as can be.  Love her and she should ping me when she moves to Bed-Stuy. Oh yeah, and a regulation pool table to boot!
author: Charles S.

description:
Still my Favorite Bar in the City after all these years. 

Great Bar Tenders, Music and Local Crowd. 

They have a Pool Table in the back with a Fireplace in the corner. 

Awesome Happy Hour and did i mention you can play DICE?!!

Yes, Dice... I will take your money though so watch the f@ck out.
author: Matthew M.

description: My kind of bar. Great cocktails, good prices, sweet happy hour deals and a pool table! The atmosphere was awesome, definitely on the dive-y side, but that's how I like it. The bartender was very nice and dang could she make a mean cocktail. Played a couple rounds of pool and all of the patrons were really friendly and fun to play with. I'll definitely be coming back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Macy G.

description:
It's a dive bar! The drinks are simple and decently strong, and the prices are reasonable. There's a pool table in the back, and the place doesn't seem to ever get too crowded.

If you're looking for a basic dive where you can unwind at the end of a long day, this a good choice.
author: Dan D.

description: A bar with the best drinks and happy hour in town. The staff was friendly and people were easy to talk to.
author: Matthew G.

description:
This is one of my girlfriend's neighborhood spots, so I've been here a few times after work. It's a dive bar, but I love it! $4 pints during happy hour!

They have a long bar, a couple tables, a pool table and a smoking room. I typically hang out in the smoking room with my gf gabbing and drinking beers. Many many beers. Over hours at a time! (Yes, we can talk a lot. Especially with alcohol!)

I love the chill atmosphere here. It's never too crowded, which I love since we can always find a seat. When I'm looking for a laid back time and some beers after work, Bacchus kirk is the place to be!
author: Elena N.

description:
Juke box, pool table, fire place, cheap drinks. Great place to hang out with friends.
I've been here twice and neither time was overly crowded.
author: Angela C.

description: Pretty chill locals place, I love the fireplace (unless it's hot out) and it's a good place to hang out for a while. What I don't like is sitting near the smokers cage... it bleeds out.. and although the bar staff is friendly, getting their attention at times is a hassle; however I assume that could be because I don't frequent enough. It is what it is. But good place we will continue to frequent.
author: Chuck R.

description: My favorite place in the world to hang out! Great fireplace, great people, and the bartenders are the best! They also have a pool table and a smoking room!
author: Jemma P.

description:
Bar.  Sitting area.  Pool table at the back.

Memorable drink - Spicy Paloma - she sounds like a prostitute, ha!  2 seconds into the sip, you feel the spicy jalapeno take over your mouth.  And then everything calms down.  LIKE!
author: Pam S.

description:
"I really shouldn't stay."
"Baby it's cold outside." 

Bacchus Kirk is such a cozy bar that truly makes you not want to leave especially when the temperatures dip to near freezing in SF. Ok it seldom gets near freezing but I can be a wus. Thank goodness for mulled wine which is a special today. 

Bartender was super delightful and happy hours till 8 are among the latest in the neighborhood. $3.50 pints and $2 of specialty cocktails. There were even free hotdogs tonight. 

Find a place by the fire under the faux ski lodge roof and suddenly it's not that cold out anymore. Well baby, I guess I will stay.
author: Jon L.

description: Came by here with some co-workers for a drink. It's your basic dive bar, not really many interesting folks here. The drinks are reasonably priced and they have lots of tables and seating. It's not the best choice for the area, but it's also not a bad place to get a drink.
author: Jonah K.

description:
Pretty legit/chill bar in lower nob. We randomly stumbled upon this place, packed it with 30 co-workers, and began to flow alcohol. There was only one person working at that time, Kirsten, and boy was she hauling major ass. With nearly 50-60 people trying to order drinks, she was running all over the place, and did it with a positive attitude.

She made great drinks, got us our drinks as quickly as she was able to, and had fun with the crowd.

This spot is very chill, has TVs to watch sports games, and allows you to bring in pizza from across the street. Wish I found this spot earlier.
author: Albert K.

description: Chill little bar near union square, which is becoming one of my favorite neighborhoods to go out in. The drinks weren't bad, and the atmosphere was awesome!
author: Zach H.

description:
Sat at the bar alone for about 10 minutes
 on the end waiting to order a drink. After the bartender came my way a couple times after serving a crowd that had just walked in she finally came over.  But then she checked the ids and served two other people who just walked up next to where I was sitting. It was poor service because obviously I was waiting for a drink with no one else around me.
author: Kyle W.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar. Great staff and ambience. A gem with great selections, specialty drinks and attentive staff. The music...killer. Wish the drinks weren't so expensive, but I'm coming back. On payday ;-)
author: Bil G.

description:
My husband and I came here with a friend who lives in San Francisco and appreciates this bar.  We were visiting from Seattle because my husband was training in San Fran for work and we needed something to do with a Saturday night.
Totally a legit place to be!  Dogs to cuddle everywhere and the angry lesbian behind the bar was uninterested in helping us but loved our friend's pretty straight girlfriend.
We lounged around here for an hour or so.

Bring on the Bacchanalia!
Just kidding it wasn't that exciting.
But it was definitely worth drinking at!
author: Sean C.

description:
The bartenders here clearly hate anyone who darkens the doorway. 

If you enjoy passive aggressive bullshit,  then Goddamn, this is the place for you. 

It looks like a nice cozy spot, with the fireplace and the pool table...but it's a lie. A forest fire wouldn't warm you up from the cold shoulder you're going to get. 

Maybe you'll need to make it rain as soon as you walk through that door. I have a feeling it would require a lot of bens to make these hens crack a smile. 

Go to Edinburgh instead.
author: Annie W.

description: Good atmosphere and decent cocktails, though I didn't find it to be a standout considering the wealth of options in the area. The fireplace is nice and they do have a pool table, though. I will probably end up coming back here since it's right across the street.
author: Ananya M.

description:
Good bar. Great happy hour specials. Friendly service. 
Super Dive-Y... not that there's anything wrong with that.
The music was way too loud sometimes and almost indistinguashably quiet other times. Bad sound system I guess. Most of the songs contained an abundance of F-Bombs, which is fine as long as they're good songs. In this case... not so much.
It was okay, but one drink was enough in this bar.
author: Charles S.

description: Absolute worst bartender. She was at other side of bar drinking & talking to friends while 7  different patrons waited for her. This occurred 2  separate times. 3rd time we all left.
author: Evette M.

description:
For a going away party for a girlfriend, she whispered it would be at Bacchus Kirk. I was already downtown, inside Westfield Mall, on my way to Muni - thinking I wouldn't go because of a long day at work. Instead, I walked uphill to Bacchus Kirk to meet the party. I'm very glad I did.

Not a crowded bar. Which I love. Clean. Which is such a plus. Beautiful layout. Walk in to a red lighted bar. Bar to your left, seat booths to your right. A smoking area, which was a patio with lovely iron gate and sliding door. There is a pool table just straight ahead. The place is spacious, friendly bartenders, and the prices are reasonable. 

This bar tops my list. Will definitely be back again and again
author: Jacqueline L.

description: Rudest bouncer in SF. Most unfriendly people I've encountered in the city.
author: Rob A.

description:
I'm astounded by the reviews of the poor service here.  Last night we walked in around 8:30 and I asked if there were any specials on for the night and as we'd just missed happy hour, she said "everyone of you is special" in her charming Irish accent.  Totally nice, funny and really the kind of bartender you want.  Not chatty, but humorous and takes care of you.  

The drinks - I had a vodka soda and a well gin martini - both were fine, if not generous, and reasonably priced. 

The pool table was empty and we took it over.  There's room all around the pool table to get your shots in -it took us a while after two or three adult bevs -  and a place to put your drinks (which isn't on the pool table, obvs).  We got ousted after one round by a guy who'd brought his own cue, but that was fine. 

Take note: at around 9:30 seemingly every Tuesday, a bar crawl comes through.  Evidently it's a hostel bar crawl and last night I swear the bar went from being a comfortable twenty people to being totally jammed.  The Bacchus Bartenders prepare for it, but us locals skedaddled.  

Overall, when not full of bar crawlers, this place is great. A nice local bar (not fancy, but comfortable and well maintained) with ample space, a smoking room if you so desire, a jukebox, and good atmosphere.
author: Paige B.

description: New favorite bar!! Great happy hour prices and I'm in love with the interior. The bartender was super friendly and there were good tunes playin'. I'm excited to come back!
author: Jamie T.

description:
Being new to San Francisco, the first couple of days were a bit rough, it was raining more than usual and one day I stopped by this bar because I wanted to get out of the rain and it had a working fireplace...it was the best idea I ever had.
The bar was very warm and cozy, the music was great (there was nice mixture of everything from Black Keys to Stevie Wonder to Pink).
The locals greeted me with open arms and gave me a lot of great tips on how to find an apartment to places to eat and a month later this has been my little haven whenever I need to unwind. 
And to top it all off, they have my favorite beer-Delirium Tremens! If you've never had it, I highly recommend it but be warned the alcohol content is a bit higher than most beers. 
Cheers BK for making me feel at home.

Did I mention it has a pool table?
author: Alina C.

description:
This wonderful neighborhood bar was right down the street from the awesome Petit Auberge, where hubby and I spent a memorable week.

Hubby only gives this place four stars, but he didn't have the pineapple-ginger martini-like drink (can't remember the real name) that I did.  It was abso-f'n-lutely delicious, which may explain why I had one more than I should have.

The bartender here was a doll and all of the patrons we spoke to were interesting and engaging. Well worth a visit!
author: Lynn H.

description:
I would never know this place existed if my friend didn't live on the same corner. But he introduced me to Bacchus Kirk last Fall, and it was the first stop of the night with some out-of-town friends a couple of weeks ago.

It's pretty hipster, but they're serving up big draft beers (Anchor Steam, Stella, and a few other good brand names) for $3.50 until 8 PM, even when we went on a Friday. Pool table has been busy both times I've been here by some pretty stereotypical SF hipsters, but there are plenty of TVs to watch a Giants game, or something.

It's a hike to get there, but BK has a beautiful inside, especially in the cooler months, and will be a go-to for me in the future.
author: Conrad B.

description: Cheap drinks, pool table, juke box, fireplace, smoking room, nice and good bartenders.
author: Ella R.

description: Loved it. 70's ski lodge is a great way to describe it. Boddingtons on tap made me happy.
author: Mark M.

description: Not bad if you go alone or with a small group. But this place really can't handle a big group. It gets too hot because they run the fireplace apparently all the time. The beer is fairly well priced but I really didn't see anything worth coming back for--or avoiding. It's just a place that serves booze.
author: Cori N.

description: Treated with utter disdain and disrespect because I ordered something that the bartender felt was not ...  I don't know, not something...  I mean get real...  I did not come in for the staff's attitude, I came in for a drink.  Serve me, take my money and leave me alone.  Let's just be pleasant, I'm not expecting anything else.
author: ein bier bitte k.

description:
Saturday night. Pub Crawl. 8 bars total. Memorable ones, good and bad.

Stop #1:
Bacchus Kirk is definitely ski lodge like. Dark and cozy. Log-like walls with fireplace. Pool table in the back. A very laidback place. 

Will come again!
author: Marti L.

description:
Stop #4 for Friday night's happy hour. 

I like this place. I don't know exactly why, it's just a nice, chill place to hang out & have a drink (or 2, in our case). Plenty of places to sit, jovial crowd, clean bathrooms, even a smoking room! We all ordered mojitos which were delicious, but after 2 we realized they had almost no alcohol in them. We were all too chicken to go ask for an extra shot of rum. That was my only complaint for this place. I guess that's what you get for the reduced HH price...reduced alcohol!
author: Erin S.

description:
This might be one of my favorite dive bars in SF! The drinks are good, the bartender is awesome and the jukebox is one of my favorites (Vampire Weekend on a SF jukebox? I love it!). You can bring food in (hellloooo Uncle Vito's!) and chow down while you drink.

My friends and used to come here waaaaaay back in the day to play trivia on Tuesdays. Those days are long gone, but the bar still has a chill vibe. This is the place you go to drink. Not socialize. Just drink. And, it's awesome.
author: Shachi B.

description:
1. Dog friendly, but keep your pooch on a leash 
2. Love the dark red ambiance with the roaring fire
3. Bar staff is attentive and friendly--Mandy is my fav
4. great HH specials
5. Mulled Wine during the Christmas season- yum!
6. Great cocktail combos
7. Great place during the week, weekends get crowded,but still manageable
8. Smoker's area in the front that is gated so you can take your Drink-- it's really small though.

 It's not a "pick up" bar, so you can enjoy a cocktail solo or w friends in a casual, laid-back environment.
author: Desiree P.

description:
Bacchus Kirk, our last stop of the night!  I can't believe I even made it this far!  I still hadn't slept yet.  That was something like hour 40 with little to no sleep.  Man, I'm a trooper or was just still reeling from the race!

This bar is so wonderful!  It's a Scottish pub right near Union Square, so that meant it was super close to our timeshare!  YES!  I was so over any form of exercise at that point, but we had to check this place out.  I'm so happy that we did!  It looks like a complete run down dive from the outside, but as soon as you walk in...TA-DA, it's a hip, lounges type bar complete with pool tables & a great jukebox.
The best part of this bar was the 'short' chairs.  They were soooo cute.  They were short because the bar itself doesn't change in height, but the floor does!  We were sitting at the end and we ascended 3 steps, pulled out the chairs & had a seat!  It was so comical to us.  Could have been delirious or a bit tipsy, but this was the best part of the night!

Ordered our drinks, had about a sip, then I was done.  Exhaustion overtook my body.  We paid the friendly & attentive bartender and off we went into the night!

I love SF!  Thanks again Anna for helping me celebrate the race!
author: Emily S.

description:
DRINK:
1.) Moonshine corn whiskey w/ ginger beer = They have ginger beer! But use dark rum instead equals mm delish

*They had another cocktail that looked interesting.. will be willing to try it next time


SERVICE:
Good


ATMOSPHERE:
Nice divey bar, pool table in the back, a cool tiny smoking room in the front so ppl can puff and drink..
author: Angela L.

description:
I can't pronounce the name of this bar, but I still like it. it has a dark inside, but feels warm at the same time.  they have a pretty good pool table and carry Bass Ale on tap!  its only like a 1/2 block away so i find myself here for most of my "lets grab a beer" feelings.

not sure why i like this place so much...but i DO!
author: Tim R.

description:
I went here last night for a girl friend's birthday party and I love the "lodge" feel you get from this place.  The ceiling has exposed wooden beams and the red lighting gives you the illusion that you're in a cabin with a roaring fire.

The bar has a pool table, a couple of TVs and a jukebox for entertainment.

I will be getting mojitos here again!
author: Eleanor L.

description:
Had a drink or few before going to see Obama speak last week. (I had to do something to calm the nerves before I met the man who's still sending people to die in the Middle East. Just cause he ain't Bush don't mean it still ain't wrong)

 What a great place! I highly suggest hitting up their happy hour (goes til 8 I think) and having a pomegranate margarita. I was transported to a sunny summer day at the lake! 

The bar tender was super cool and the decor was posh. 
It didn't hurt that there were some gorgeous Australian men in the bar as well. Anyhow, check this place out - good happy hour prices, cool people, pretty place.
author: Twinstar G.

description:
Following a renovation that included a change in their sign and frontage, Bacchus Kirk has an inviting woodsy feel.  The large front windows allow passersby to see the red-lighted interior that beckons.  Sadly, that's pretty much it.  Despite a fun, handwritten cocktail menu on the wall above the bar, this is a strictly beer and whiskey joint.  If you stay with the tried and true (G&T, Jack & Coke, etc.) you won't be disappointed.  If you stray, watch out.  Even drinks from their own menu seem a bit beyond the bartender.  

Kirk seems to have a loyal following and if you're not among them expect a chilly exchange at the bar.  There are a lot of other bars (average and otherwise) in the area that will take your money with more ease.
author: QuodE D.

description:
start with the kiwi flower martini deliciousnesssssss!  then, chug on through the rest of their specials : )

plus, excellent mix of music and no crazy crowd to deal with!

LOVE that there is a smoking room so you don't leave the place wreaking of cigs.
author: Mimi D.

description:
Two words. A-hole. Usually I give my bars of choice 3 strikes to consider if I'm a huge fan and if it's worth coming in for a drink. 

I get it. I don't look like a bitchy slut from snob hill ( ok well minus the slut part hah) doesn't mean it should take you 7 minutes to make a damn cocktail. On a Tuesday night. I'd understand If my friends and I were extemely wasted and loud and obnoxious and the guy would take his time serving us. But it wad 6pm. I wasn't even buzzed and just wanted a drink after work but that was clearly asking too much. What's that you say? Oh Amanda don't get your panties in a twist. Well maybe I wouldn't except the fact there were 4 other people in the place besides me and my friends and the bartender just acted like it was such a hassel to make our drinks. I'm sorry. It's happy hour. Do your job. I'm not paying for your snobby up the ass attitude I'm paying to get drunk and make bad decissions.

Like I said. Usually three strikes and you're out for me. Here, twice is enough. Not impressed. Props to the decorator. Boo to everything else.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Ultra chill spot that we decided to hit up after Nopa... plus we missed guestlist at Starlight... Someone described it as being like a "lodge". That hit it right on the head!

Theres a pool table in the back, with a juke box that plays some random stuff (Nate Dogg passed away last week, so we were getting a lot of old school Snoop and Dr. Dre). Not too much seating room aside from the stools at the bar and a couple of booths, so you could say the place is intimate.

Great drink prices, even at non-happy  hour times. Convenient too, considering it was about 2 blocks away from my friend's place. 

Definitely down to come back here to try one of their specials.
author: Marc T.

description:
Booo!  Why the hell advertise all those creative concoctions when your bartender has no interest in making them?  The first 3 drinks we tried to order couldn't be made because they "ran out" of certain ingredients.

After ordering 2 drinks listed on the board that could be made, the bartender paused, sighed, then forced her neck to tilt while looking up at the ingredients...figuring out what is in the drinks.  Body language = I really don't wanna make these goddam drinks.

I took a look around the bar and realized that everyone in the place was drinking beer, not cocktails.  I assume the lure of their happy hour is to go and get beer at a discount.

The drinks were horrible and couldn't be finished.  We left after barely managing to suck down half of each drink.  So back to the question...Why the hell advertise drinks your bartender a) has no interest in making and b) doesn't care to make them right?
author: Pete M.

description:
Whenever I am in this neighborhood I try to make a stop at the Bacchus Kirk. It feels like a little ski lodge with the fireplace lit on a cool evening.

They used to have Pabst on tap but dropped it for some cider. Minus one point ... The jukebox is really good though, and the pool table is fairly level and well lit.

The owners/bar tenders are Scottish, so expect an accent, and some Euro friends to be sprinkled throughout the joint.
author: Wes T.

description:
Went to grab a beer with a friend of mine on a Monday night. It was kind of nice that it wasn't really packed like some other places, but maybe it was because it was Labor Day...

Great bartender, cool layout, pool table in the back with a big 'ol chalkboard. Didn't care for the choice of tunes on the jukebox, but the smoking room is a real cool touch (even if it is a bit small). I think the room could only fit maybe 6 people comfortably, and it's got a window that opens up to the street.

Good neighborhood bar - I'll probably head back at some point.
author: David H.

description: Nice neighborhood dive bar.  Nothing stands out much, I wouldn't go there by planning, but it is comfortable place to stop by on the way home, and usually nice crowd.  I like their happy hour cocktails. Nice staff.
author: Bailey H.

description:
What I haven't written a review of BK?  Actually I don't know anyone who calls it that, but was too lazy to type out the name but have actually typed way more explaining it.

Anyhow, we took the whole studio here for drinks after our holiday dinner (just added the pix) and I've been there numerous times before.  The bartenders may not be the most attentive all the time, but if you make sure they know you are in need of some booze they'll take care of you.

Oh yeah the juke box is not bad either!

The space itself is nice too - pretty cozy and a warm feel and there's a convenient smoking area for you stinky smokers.
author: Gene X.

description: Absolutely one of my favorite bars in the neighborhood. The bartenders are always friendly, good selection of beers on tap, a fireplace, pool table, and plenty of seating. It's never overly crowded, but always a good variety of people inside. Great music always playing... I can't really ask for more from a local bar. This place is great!
author: Ashley D.

description:
This place is streaky.  Good when tourists are staying in nearby hostels (hostel discount at the bar, wink), some good convos to be had with an international crew.  Other times just a chill (warm) spot to have a drink with a friend.  

Good place to start out the night, or come back to for a chill vibe.
author: Justin B.

description:
Great "local bar" feel where everyone really does know your name. Bartenders take the time to get to know you and the pool table always has great competition (just be sure to put your name on the chalkboard and wait your turn - winner keeps the table!) Indoor smoking area is a plus but don't get confused by the bathroom situation. (One Men's room and one unisex/handicap, sorry ladies).
Weekends are usually pretty packed but great to grab a taste during the week. If aren't into big crowds, be careful from ~ 9-10 on Thursdays (part of the pub crawl from the local hostels) but it's a great way to meet a bunch of people from around the world!
author: Taylen P.

description:
Had passed by this place a few times and always wanted to go in, but it always been closed for some reason!  Got out of an event fairly early on Thursday night and headed in to Bacchus Kirk for a drink.  We actually got there too early for happy hour, which is 7 - 9 pm, which ordinarily would be perfect!  

Sat right up in the window but there was ample seating at large tables and the bar, as well as a pool table, cute little smoking closet, fireplace, and jukebox.  Bartender was very nice, and the regulars at the bar seemed interesting.  They have jagermeister chilled on tap, if that's your thing.  Cocktail menu seemed decently creative, although can't vouch as I just had a vodka soda. 

Restroom was bright pink and covered in graffiti, which seemed out of tough with the rest of the place's vibe (more dark woods, green, and blue.)  I did hear someone say they were renovating the bathrooms this week so maybe that will change soon.
author: Jaimie M.

description:
While it always seems to have a good share of tourists, there's a consistent local following as well. Great local bar with good selection of beer on tap & creative cocktails. A great place to start -- or end the night. 

Nonsmokers beware, smokers listen up: There's a super-smoky smoking room that holds about 6 comfortably.  Bonus: this room faces Bush so there's always something crazy to gawk at passing by.

Pool table, good selection of tunes in the jukebox box, & red lighting makes this place a home-away-from-home for thirsty Nob Hill residents.
author: Kate L.

description:
I came here for the first time the other night and had a genuinely good time. The decor is great, like you're in a cabin somewhere completely different than Nob Hill. The drinks are more expensive than the dives I'm used to, but nothing crazy. The bartender was super nice and was pretty attentive for being the only one working. I love any place that has a pool table and a juke box. And I don't smoke, but I do appreciate places that cater to smokers, so the smoking room is perfect! 

This place is perfect for a relaxed night just chilling with friends!
author: Victoria A.

description:
I have to say I wasn't sure I would like this place. I had heard some mixed reviews and really didn't even care if I ever made it here.......

well, aside from the fact that I have been to nearly every bar in this fine city, and not ever going would possibly ruin my reputation for knowing about every bar in the city, and I feel compelled on some level to visit every bar in the city, so I can be informed and inform you about ...okay I'll stop now, back to my review.........

Nice dark decor with lots of wood, a pool table in the back, large tables for big groups, a fireplace, low ceilings and a smoking room with far too little ventilation. When they say second hand smoke is bad this place is the endorsement that will have you running away from the smokers, and that is saying a lot since I am a smoker. However, keep your smoking to the sidewalk and this place is pretty cool.

We came here on trivia night...all 15 of us, on one team, headed up by yours truly, who may or may not have a competitive streak, and who may or may not have been channeling Emilio Estevezes fathers character in Breakfast Club as we played (and won....I wouldn't have had it any other way). So we got $30 for our efforts. John, one of our key brainiacs,  figured the best way to share the spoils with our large, obviously intelligent, team would be to buy the cheapest bottle of well alcohol they had and pass it around. Classy and innovative. I was in!! 

This bar does not do bottle service, even if you are gold metal winners.
author: Drue C.

description:
So I just moved to a apartment which is like 30 seconds from here, so far I have yet to get in any fights or banned  unlike some posters here. 

The place has been pretty quiet and chill on the weekends (the way it should be when your having a beer) and service hasn't been bad, maybe the place has changed or I haven't seen the bad side yet!
author: simon r.

description:
Grace:  I am wasted, let's call it a night.
Archie:  Sounds good.
Grace:  Hey, let's go.
Archie:  Wait what?  Where?
Grace:  We're doing shots at Bacchus.

Of course we should have continued drinking, we had only just finished  two bottles of wine, two cocktails and two Irish coffees.  

Silly me.

No big deal.

I decided to review this part of the evening first since I am still gloriously hungover.  

I must say though, hangovers are something I enjoy taking part in because of the future culinary payoff.  

At least in my mind, all the calories I eat the day after drinking don't count.  

It's only 2:30pm and I am staring at receipts from Starbucks, McDonalds, Krispy Kreme, and that crappy Pho restaurant in Mt View.  

Wait until I go to the Mexican restaurant tonight and ask for the steak taco stuffed inside the carne asada burrito served wet.  

Bacchus is a cool, casual place with some very nice bartenders who don't judge the two sloppy drunks in front of them.

Feel my face.

Inebriated.
author: Archie R.

description:
Who is this Bacchus Kirk? He likes good, albeit widely-served beers, that's for sure.

I had a variety; Guinness (poured with care), Trumer Pils & Anchor Steam all on draft. The half hipster bartender who seemed a little mismatched for this location even gave me one of my beers for free, when the Trumer Pils keg ran out just short of finishing my beer.

I was actually a little nervous entering the place for trivia night...the world of pub trivia was on my shoulders being the only male in a group of 3 women--two of which I had never met. Something I failed to recognize...my inability to retain useless pop-culture information for purposes of earning free booze or peanuts at a bar. Luckily, the girls took it easy on me. And what was with the music round here!?!? I am a guy who KNOWS my music! I knew only one of the songs during the music round here! It seemed like the MC had plucked a playlist off some modern pop station. Maybe I should listen to commercial radio again and brush up on my skills?

F**k That...

Pirate Cat Radio, Folks.
http://www.piratecatradio.com

This is a cool spot, but not quite my style...

Great service, friendly bartenders & normal Nob Hill type of clientele. I don't really understand why someone would wear a business suit to trivia night on a Tuesday evening, but maybe it's just because I'm not THAT GUY.

They had the pink soap in their bathroom dispensers--it's the soap that smells super awesome and reminds me of high school. Yea, we were lucky enough to have awesome smelling hands in high school...that's how us ex-suburbanites used to roll.

So yea, good soap & a free beer gets this place an extra star. 

I'm just a whore like that.
author: matt m.

description:
NO MORE PUB QUIZ!!!!  At least according to the bartender tonight.  The guys who run it apparently have stopped.  

Bah.  I am annoyed.
author: Beau G.

description:
Whoever made the "ski lodge" comment is dead-on.  I felt like I was in an upscale version of the Timberline Lodge near Mt. Hood.

Good thing, because it's nice to have an escape from all the San Francisco-ness sometimes :)

Well, they're my neighbors and along with Double Team Coffee, Susan's Hair Salon, Video Zone, Sushi Rika, and Bush Market, I have to give them props for being one of the good bars in the hood.
author: Justin C.

description:
A neighborhood bar you can chill out at with friends.

It gets hot and the music can get loud, but everything can't be perfect.

It's cool.
author: Kitty O.

description:
Basically a ski lodge in the middle of the city. What more could you ask for? It's a cozy bar with plenty of seating, which is a nice change of pace from most SF bars.

The little smoke room is kinda charming (don't go outside to smoke in front or the bouncer will yell at you) and much nicer than Helmock's smoke room (the only other smoke room I can think of) if you actually smoke.

Overall, a mostly low-key and cozy bar. Just a great vibe.

The bartenders are nice and friendly too ;-)
author: Jarrod B.

description:
This place caught my eye one night as I strolled down Bush.  I'm glad I finally went in.  It reminds me of a ski lodge with red, retro warmth...roomy and cozy with benches and chairs along one side, and a sweet fireplace.  A long bar runs along the other.  

For those that like to shoot, there is a pool table.

For those that like to groove, they have a juke box stocked with great tunes.

Laid back friendly mix of international patrons.  I love this place!
author: Cathy K.

description:
House, house, apartment, house, liqour store, apartment, house... FUCK!!  Where the hell IS this place!

Oh wait!!!  SMOKERS!!! Where there are smokers there is a bar!

Sure as gold there was Bacchus Kirk.  Tiny and unassuming and waiting to hold us all in a cozy warm embrace of booze and friendship.

I walk in and I litterally can't see damn thing!  The place has a dark red glow which made me feel like I should be whispering dirty things into someone's ear.  Suddenly the song TLC "Red Light Special" popped into mind.  That is one sexy dirty song....and one of my favorites song ever.  ;)

Half and hour later (no joke) my eyes adjust to the light and I can make out the bartender's face and I get a drink.  Yelpers fill the space and a fun time was had by all.  Chill spot folks.  Take a crew of homies and kick it by the fireplace or play a game of pool.

Minus one star for having ONE bartender on a Friday night.
author: Jay H.

description:
Let's get it straight, the place is fine--nice atmosphere and such.  

I just get a little annoyed when they don't have a crappy $2-$3 bud or can of PBR for the poor among us that have already sunken into a deep alcohol induced cycle of sadness and depression.

To be fair, I had a few $6 Jim Beam and Cokes that were totally of the "splash of coke for color" variety.

So three stars I guess.
author: Rocco B.

description:
He's trying to blame it on me, but really, it was not my fault.
 
His version of the events, as they unfolded - - in his skewed mind:  http://www.yelp.com/user_details_review_search?userid=AgzHzIzC6ZHTKgker0egAg&q=bacchus
 
My version of the conversation:

He had just pulled up to the front of my building to drop me off.
 
Grace:  "OK, well goodnight, Archie - thanks so much for dinner, it was delicious!!"
Archie:  (falls to the ground, kicking and flailing arms) "I don't wanna go yet!!"
Grace:  (staring down at big guy on concrete...) "Alrighty... how about one more shot right there at Bacchus, and call it a night?"
Archie: (gets up, locks car and crosses street before me)
Grace: .....
 
I don't know HOW the above is MY fault.
Sure -  the one shot turned into one shot and two beers - - and that was, perhaps, my doing... but I still don't see how it's MY fault.
 
But whoever's fault it is, we did end up entering quite drunk, and exiting completely inebriated.  Completely.
 
This morning, I get a text asking me to shoot him.
If there was even a remote chance of my getting up to go get the gun to put him out of his misery - - I would have except I was so sick that I couldn't move for a few hours.  At least.
 
Guinness on tap here - and they pour it right.
So it that great IPA I love so much but cannot remember the name of... but I never fail to recognize it when I see it.  Fat Guy?  Heavy Dude?  I dunno, something like that.
We also had chilled Ketel One shots - -and they were good pours.  

That was what did us in.
 
Service was very friendly, and though it was my first time here (in spite of it being, quite literally, across the street from me) - they treated us like old friends.  A guy who looked like Lieutenant Dang from Forrest Gump gave me a funky cigarette.  The atmosphere is friendly, homey, and while not hip or classy - - it has a good feel to it.  It feels like a neighborhood bar.... and to me, it actually is.  

 
Well, that is how I remember it anyhow and it sounds good enough to me, so THERE!
author: Grace K.

description: I wish I liked this place more so that I can become a regular. BK is cozy, dimly lit, kinda comfy. I think most patrons come here because of the smoking room. I've watched some sporting events here while sipping a few. They have the fancy cocktails at the fancy price. It's not cheap like a neighborhood bar should be. It's a bit clique. So sitting alone to watch the game will almost guarantee I won't be chatting it up with the patrons. I really wanted to like this place. meh.
author: L v.

description:
First of all, I don't care what anyone says, that was Merrill Streep not Glen Close- Hannala will back me up. Okay, now that I have said my piece lets get on with the review... 

Bar tender checked my ID I am not religious, but bless her little heart! Thank you for telling me that I look under 30 and there for you need to ID me. 

The atmosphere is very ski lodge feel, I dug it! (yes, I said "dug it" WHAT!?) Seats at the bar were in plenty, the nice man asking the questions reminded us loud folk that if we continued to yell out the answers to the trivia questions like we were at an auction, then everyone would win, not just us. Thank you nice question man. A bit on the pricey side, but their martini's were 6 bucks and very tasty, so I suppose worth it. 

I would have given this place 3 stars because it was okay, BUT the bar tender made Hannala another drink for free because SOMEONE (*cough* Sav *cough*) spilled the drink I just bought her ALL over me. So, +1. 

And seriously, it was Merrill Streep  not Glen Close. :)
author: Jessica R.

description:
Bacchus Kirk is okay...for me, it's got its really good points and its really bad points, and they even out right in the middle.

Tuesday night is trivia night, and that's really fun if it's your thing. It's really crowded, though, so you need to get there early (like before 8PM). And good luck getting a drink! Our team missed 3 trivia questions that I magically knew the answers to but didn't want to lose my spot at the bar, and didn't go consult them. Boo!

Unfortunately, this is often the case I've found at Bacchus Kirk. It's so crowded that it takes a really, really long time to get served, and it's also sometimes a million degrees in there, which is kind of accentuated by the red lights maybe.

Pros: There's a really good jukebox! And a pool table, which is a plus for some people. I like the fireplace and the kind of rustic look of the place...it reminds me of a lodge a little bit. There's a good selection of beer. I also love the neighborhood. And I do actually really like the lighting - it's just not great when it's already really hot in there.

Cons: As mentioned, this place gets PACKED. Sometimes the music is a little too loud - I think they really crank up the volume on the jukebox. And I tried to play a Massive Attack song one night and it came on when I was at the bar. Right in front of me, one of the bartenders said "Ugh, I hate Massive Attack" and changed it after only a few seconds of the song! I was really surprised...I guess partially because I didn't know they could do that and partially because I'd paid for the tunes. Also, I've found the drinks to be more expensive than I'd expect.

Another con: walk by the front door and tell me what the place smells like. It's got that sweet/sour/stale smell of old wooden bars, sort of like a mixture of beer, barf, and old athletic supporters. Once you walk in, you stop smelling it, though.
author: Heidi G.

description:
Found this bar during one of my exploratory walks when I arrived in the city a few years ago. Because of the glowy red lamps and dramatically lit and staged liquor bottles, it immediately reminded me of a scene from an early Bond film set at a ski lodge.

Bacchus Kirk is a bar best enjoyed when there are only a few customers at the bar or at a table or playing pool. When crowded, the atmosphere can become a bit ugly like some of the drunks. However, during slower periods, the bartenders here are friendly and always concerned that I enjoy my drink (yes, I can order like Sally in "When Sally Met Harry"). The music can be way too loud and abrasive, but staff will lower the volume if a regular stops by for drink and to watch an afternoon sporting event.
author: Poet D.

description:
I hate staring at bottles of booze. I hate weird half conversations with the person next to you because you almost accidentally set your purse on their foot. I also hate wiggling my feet under a stool as a source of amusement. 

You might think I hate bars --- but I don't. I didn't think that my boyfriend (who considers bottle staring, half conversations and foot wiggling a good time) and I would ever find a bar where we could both be happy. 

But, tah-dah! Bacchus Kirk! About damn time. 
        They have a fun quiz (an absolute standard in my book for a good bar.)
        They have a fireplace, with fireplace seating (no unnecessary foot wiggling here!)
        They seem like a mostly local bar, which is nice. I'd frequent this place but I don't actually live close enough to do that and free parking is basically non-existent.
        They don't do food, but you can bring in food. You should clean it up though, because the bartender and the bar back/bartender's friend are all really nice and don't really have time to be picking up your lost bits of sushi/pizza/spaghetti-o's. 

Lastly, I owe Bacchus Kirk for introducing me to one of my favorite drinks. Fernet with a Ginger back. Silly me, the first time I tried it I was like oh, yum, dirt. Wonderful. Then the bartender at Baccus suggested I try it with a ginger back and hoo-ray, dirt taste be gone!

So everyone should go for the next quiz, Tuesdays (9 pm). I'll be on the team that starts out really good, then gets a little bit too silly and winds up blowing it. But maybe we'll win some day...maybe...if no one else shows up?

Note: Next time I go I will try and figure out what the prizes and other pertinent quiz info is and update this review accordingly.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
Bacchus Kirk represents one of the more artful interior designs I've seen in a drinking establishment. It's layout achieves the delicate balancing act of being artsy yet not arrogant, and hip while still feeling homey.  Whoever put  this place together took a dicey mix of decorative elements....ones that often spell disaster when used improperly, and managed to pull everything together in a truly impressive manner.  They tastefully used the ever-so-dicey medium of pecky cedar for most of the interior, but did so in a way that circumvents the almost inevitable pitfall of creating a space that looks like a re-cycled cowboy bar.  It's artfully mixed with several other minor nuances like tasteful lighting, evenly drilled angle-iron, and patches of older stonework left over from the bar's previous decorative schema.  A worn hardwood floor helps round things out with by adding a touch of mustiness to a well-rounded set of walls.  Music is young, hip, and not too loud.

I got here several hours after France had eliminated Brazil from the World Cup. There was a easy going crowd in place, but seated patrons and place-saving drinks forced me further down the bar near a thirty-something guy with heavy tattoos.  A cute-as-a-button girl with French flag in her hair sat one more seat over from him.  French-flag girl was fairly tipsy, and tattoo guy seemed to be pretty attentive whenever she came around.  I tried striking up chitchat with tattoo guy whenever French-flag-girl drifted away, but to no avail.  He'd answer me in terse, incomplete sentences while doing everything he could to avoid eye contact.  The rest of the crowd was a good ethnic mix with mean age of about 30 years and a standard deviation of 4.

Despite a somewhat cheery crowd, great decor, and a decent selection of drinkables, I caught an odd vibe from this place.  Maybe it was the soccer crowd, maybe it was just the vibe I got from tattoo guy.  Regardless, I saw my empty glass as reason to move along rather than re-fill.  Bacchus Kirk is a pretty decent bar.  It's a good  place for groups, a good spot to take a date, and a great local hangout if you lived in the hood.  But if you drop in solo, don't expect bubbly chitchat from the regulars right off the bat....and be ready to drink alone.
author: Mike W.

description:
My cube mate was arranging a happy hour and since I really wanted to watch the Heat and Mavs play Game 3, he suggested Bacchus Kirk since it has a couple of screens.  Always up for exploring a new place, I trooped over after work with some colleagues to check out this local watering hole.

I didn't feel like ordering any adult beverages so I stuck to water, but I was impressed by the 7pm happy hour start time.  I've never been a fan of rushing to get an early drink special so it was refreshing (ha ha, me so punny) to find a place with a more reasonable schedule.  All of my coworkers liked their drinks and the menu did look interesting, so I'll have to try one of the house drinks next time.

They don't serve any bar food which was extremely disappointing (those who know me understand how important food is to me!) but they have plenty of menus on hand of nearby places to order food from.  Chicken wings and curly fries were soon delivered and I was able to finally concentrate on the basketball game.  Bacchus Kirk has quite a few TVs spread about the room ranging from small CRTs to a very large showcased flat panel so finding a good view wasn't a problem.

Since it was a Tuesday night, they had bar trivia start around 9pm.  I've heard of bar trivia before, but I had never tried it so of course I had to stay to play.  It was a lot of fun and pretty interesting...they had two random facts rounds, one musical round, and one name-that-celebrity photo round.  According to the surrounding people, it's better than the bar trivia at a lot of other places, so I'm glad I had a positive first experience!

The decor is unremarkable in a typical neighborhood sports bar kind of way.  Rather dark lighting, lots of wood, slightly sticky tables and chairs, and the requisite pool table in the back.  But the staff is unpretentious, parking isn't bad, and the crowd is a nice eclectic bunch with a mostly chill vibe.  I wouldn't mind returning to this comfy and fun bar...especially on a Tuesday night.  Bar trivia anyone?
author: Helen T.

description:
I did a film race yesterday and this was like the base camp so we turned in our film at midnight and stayed for the wrap party. Honestly, I wouldn't come to a bar in nob hill. It's just not my crowd, hence no cute guys for me. 

The service was lame. There were two bartenders but the other one seemed like new and didn't even speak english very well. It was pretty frustrating. The other one seemed to know what she's doing but order took a long time since she had to pick up the newbie's slack. I gotta say the mojito was good though =)
author: Perry S.

description:
I dropped by on a Tuesday Trivia night.  Fun! Cash for 1st & 2nd, nuts for 3rd - 5th.  I guess that qualifies as borderline bacchanalian activity?  ...If you count groups of revelers with faces contorted, biting their lips in concentration to culminate in an often simultaneous "OH!" an orgy.  So cool are the groups that commandeer a table and sip their 1 water/light beer for the duration of the game and ditch as soon as they pick up their cash.  Real winners here.

No domestic beer on tap... only in bottles.  They only pump premium.  I expected to be overcharged, but the drinks were very well priced.

1 pool table.  Tends to get burning hot in here on busy nights like Trivia Tues.  Good thing the fireplace wasn't on.   I suspect they kept the double doors shut to prevent the orgiastic noise from escaping into the quiet midweek night.  The squares out there really need to get with the squares in here.
author: Marjorie B.

description:
I wish I had more to tell you about this place. It's nicely decorated, sort of a ski lodge/sauna/korean barbecue motif going on. There's about the right balance of tables and standing room, and a cool semi-enclosed smoking patio in front. The crowd seemed like a pretty cool mix of people as well.

I'd give this place more stars If there was more help behind the bar on busy nights, the drinks were more moderately priced, and I'm not into trivia nights. I shouldn't say this because I enjoyed the spoils of my teams victory without contributing much, but I'd gladly pay for that bottle of budweiser if I get to enjoy the bars natural atmosphere without distraction.  I'll bet this is a pretty cool spot on other evenings.
author: matthew r.

description:
Bacchus Kirk is on its way to becoming my favorite neighborhood bar. Because our normal happy hour spot Cantina was closed for a private party on Monday we came here. I've been a few times and never really had a good time. 

Four mojitos and a tequila shot later I was attempting to play pool.. and really sucking at it. Their mojitos are wonderful and inexpensive, plus they have $2 draft (I could be wrong on this.. due to my level of intoxication) and good happy hour specials. 

Thank you for being there for me during my week/month of turmoil Bacchus Kirk and thank you for only being a block from my house (sadly an uphill walk)! I will be back very soon!
author: Sarah W.

description: I never would of thought to come to this place. My friend lives a block away so we went over and it was real big and nice in there. It wasn't overly crowded on a Saturday night, nice crowd and good variety of drinks.
author: Karen T.

description:
Great laid-back place.  I love the elevated window seating areas--private and cozy for you and your main squeeze.   The music selection goes with the chill vibe and is at a level where you can have a full conversation without getting hoarse.  Their pours are nice, and they have plenty of great beers on tap.  No drama, no fuss.

Update 3/7/06: Oh BK, what happened?  The service was slow even after taking my drink order. But the most abominable thing happened next. The bartender had accidently poured Grey Goose Orange in the martini.  Fine if the bartender scrapped that one and made a new drink, but instead she stopped mid-pour, retrieved the correct Grey Goose, and finished mixing the drink. Result: orange-tainted martini with vermouth and green olives. This one wins no taste awards.
author: M A N I K.

description:
local for me...trivia night with Cash prizes...a little pricey

UPDATE:  apparently the bartenders don't like to be interupted when chatting or when putting away dishes.  what happened to customer service.  i don't mind waiting my turn if it's other people NOT dishes or conversation.  they owe me two apologies

Tunnel Top is too close to waste your time here.
author: kiki b.

description:
My boyfriend and I were out in San Francisco, on Saturday night. I really wanted to check out this bar. We went in around 9:30 and it was not crowded at all. But when my bf went to the bar, the bartender ignored him. He then came back and asked for his ID. then walked away! Thinking that he would come back, and he did...to ask the guy next to my boyfriend what he wanted to drink! 
RUDE!
We had been waiting for about 15 minutes, and the bartender snubs us!
Whatever, we didnt need you Bacchus Kirk, there is always Tunnel Top.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Last Friday I met a bunch of OG Yelpers here for a good old fashioned Friday night of debauchery.  Things I liked about the place-happy hour 'til 9pm, friendly bartenders and it's dog friendly.  Now I'm not one of those people who insists on bringing my dog everywhere but it was nice to be able to pop in with Willie for a bit so he could meet some Yelpers.  And since Bacchus is mere blocks from my apt I was able to take him home when it got overwhelming for him and return in no time at all.
-1 star for taking 20 minutes to get my first beer.  I'll definitely be back on a school night when it's not as crowded and I may even bring a fluffy white dog with me.
author: phil h.

description: Great people. Good times. Better vibe. Tremendous jukebox!
author: J M.

description:
Stumbling out of the women's restroom, I learned 3 life-changing things:

"Date like a man...so you don't get played"

"Never make a man your priority when he makes you an option"

and more importantly, "This place rocks my anal world"

Those are just some of the funny quotes written inside the women's restroom.  I honestly think ZAGAT'S wife wrote the last one.  It explains why the place has 3 different ZAGAT stickers posted on the door.  

+4 for the wonderful happy hour until 9.  Did I mention that their happy hour doesn't only consist of beer and vodka-crans?  Yay to $5 cocktails.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
We visited this nice little neighborhood spot for a friend's birthday. I think  we overwhelmed the bartender with our crew as the service was very slow. 

Lots of places to sit, and a cozy little fireplace rounded out this bar. It's a great spot for a chill night out if you happen to be in the neighborhood. I could take it or leave it, but I certainly enjoyed visiting here once!
author: Kelly C.

description: Ahhh my neighborhood watering hole.  The place from whence I hear strange noises and folks doing and saying wierd things at all hours of the night.  The place from whence I stumble home after getting sloppy and leaving my heart on the bar.  Yea, that is where I left it.  On the bar next to my r&c.
author: Michele O.

description:
Aah, Bacchus Kirk.  Pronounced Back-us Kirk, for those of you not in the know; the sign has that weird u that looks like a v.  So it's hard.  Anywhooo...  For some reason, every time I've been here it has been for marriage-related reasons.  Time #1--reception for City Hall wedding of friends.  Time #2--engagement party.  Time #3--after-wedding reception-party for friends from time #2.  

It's a cool bar, way down on Bush, so definitely no parking and even catching a taxi at 2 am is difficult.  But...the bar's cool.  Like other reviewers have noted, it def. has the ski lodge vibe--log cabin-y, with a fireplace and nice bartenders.  There's also a pool table, and a floor which can be used for dancing, although I wouldn't go so far as to call it a dance floor.  

Cool place, good drinks, fun times, four stars.

Edit--I drove by here today and alas, the sign doesn't have the V=U anymore.  It used to.  I'm pretty sure.  Standing by my man, I mean, review...
author: kelly m.

description:
Cute Joint!
I swung by for Julie's "Last Happy Hour" in SF and have NO Complaints... bartenders were seriously great and kept a smile all night despite how busy they were. If you're hungry, grab a slice at Cybelle's (up the block) and have a bev or 2... their happy hour is from 7-9 (LUV that!)
author: Anna S.

description:
I don't know if Bacchus is one of my favorites, but it is one of the neighborhood bars we frequent the most. It is comfortable and quiet if you go before 10 or 11pm.
The jukebox and pool table are small perks, as well as the friendly bartenders. I don't like how they covered the front windows with large, obtrusive plants as I can no longer people watch without looking as though I am creepily hiding behind plants. The small smoking room makes sense since the shmokers outside can get pretty loud, but it took away one of the awesome little elevated-table-and-seat areas.
Check it out if you are in the neighborhood.. Or not, and you are in  another neighborhood and just want to go to a small bar on Bush Street... whatever.
author: Syd V.

description:
1. A dancer from the "Nob Hill" whipped out his "talents" in the smoking area upon request here.  Hey, I was just curious as to what sort of resume one has to have to work there. Can ya blame a girl?

2. Bartenders are willing to accompany me in Fernet.

3. Cozy and the jukebox doesn't suck.

'Nuff said.  Love it.
author: Jennifer s.

description:
Lose the pretentious name and I would like this place a little more!

Their happy hour beings at 7pm, a bit later than most bars, and their Tuesday Trivia Nights are always a fun challenge!

A small, overall average, bar with a pool table, smoking room, and sofas.  Decent beer choices on tap, too.
author: Scott G.

description:
I love this place! I Never had a bad time over here, I always come on mondays when Pam its working she is a beautiful bartender and before you walk to the bar she already have your drink ready for you.
I love the idea of a Tahoe cabin, warm, fire place  and they have a SMOKING room (what else can you ask for)!!!!
The music is always good and the regulars are very sweet, love love love This bar!
author: Jennifer m.

description:
This is not a bar I'd frequent if it weren't for their Trivia Tuesday nights.  On those nights, arrive early and claim some seats, because as you'll see, seating becomes a premium.  And if you think standing throughout all of trivia is going to be OK.  It's not.  No fun, especially in heels.

Prizes are $30 for first place, $20 for 2nd, $10 for 3rd and cans of nuts for 4th/5th place or for the team with the most clever name.  Trivia is actually pretty fun even though we're not that great at it.  And I don't like how uber-competitive some of the teams get, like they'll hog the color version of the photo sheet.  Seriously, it's just a game, people.

Parking is hit or miss.  Sometimes you get lucky and find a spot right away, and sometimes you'll circle for 15 minutes.  So good luck on that.

Another minus, they won't serve cocktails off their happy hour menu after happy hour.  Is that typical?  Just because it's not happy hour, doesn't mean you don't have any watermelon pucker available.  Ridiculous.

But a plus, the trivia guy recognizes us each week, so that's fun.
author: spiff e.

description:
some of the best bartenders in town keep me coming back here - Mike,  Lacy and Mary!

Great wee bar - wonderful bartenders and cosy vibe.....only problem is that it is hard to leave.   Just a nice casual neighborhood bar - there are so few places like this left......
author: Alison M.

description:
Bunch of the group thought Ed was gonna get all excited being the logo kinda resembles Arby's...oh shiznay!  never even noticed this place from the many times of rolling to Sushi Rika which is nearly right across the street.  

Anyhow, from the way the last two spots panned out, anyplace that has a bit of service, some cool heads and a bit of style was gonna get some yelp love from me.  I started things up with a Jameson just to make sure i was on point, Interpol playin on the juke--tiight! friendly peeps i don't know sayin whaddup- yes!!!  

Thats the kinda love i was expecting on our Saturday night voyage...bunch of the guys were slammin dice on the tables- i still don't know the game they were playin tho Gabe said it was like bullshit.

Um...place is kinda seedy..a smoking room right near the front entrance--ho-hum on that one.  Like the vibe goin on here with nice staff and a mix of hoodies and locals.  I ended the night with a snake-bite nite cap...how lame is that?  Keane is cool.
author: omar b.

description: Used to love this place b/c of the juke box, crowd & pool table. Went last night after a long time of not going. $9 vodka cran & $8 wine AT happy hour?! And the dullest, most non-attentive bartendress ever. Sorry but this place has lost it's charm and if i'm paying those prices at happy hour, then i better be in spot that doesn't smell like stinky rancid beer and dirty bar rags. Now, if you're only into drinking beer and you don't mind the stench and the bad attitude from bartender, then is is passable. I say go to Ambassador Lounge which has beautiful interior and great folks working there
author: Nancy L.

description:
Went here on a quiet Monday night with the hot guy who lives next door.  The drinks and the company were great but I did kind of wish the bartender had been a little more solicitous so that I could have gotten buzzed faster and taken off my clothes sooner.  Ah well, she did humor me by concocting a Russian Prelude for me, a drink most have never heard of.  Just remember Very Bad Kentucky Fried Chicken (vodka,baileys, kahlua, frangelico, cream) and thank me later.
***updated to add***
Hot guy next door has moved back to the East Coast but this is my new regular watering hole.  LOVE IT!!  The bartenders are the best and the smoking room rocks!  We have successfully instituted the new rule that Wednesday is the new Thursday (and Thursday is the new Friday) so celebrate "Hump Day" bitchez!
author: Jill D.

description:
Decent place. Gets a little loud on weekends, but otherwise this neighborhood bar is pretty cool! Nice, chill atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and the price is right for the drinks.
Especially enjoy the tables by the window, get to people watch...which is always fun!
Good jukebox: got Stones, Radiohead, Led Zep and other classic rock. Got a pool table for those who care....(not my cup of tea).

Would have given it four stars but on weekend nights sometimes gets so loud that you can't hear any conversation. Which is never the key...
author: DJ R.

description:
A decent-enough place. Stands out given it's neighborhood and it's  not obscenely crowded, even on a Friday night. It even has a smoking room for people who still do that. Bacchus has a lot of potential. 

Had the bartenders have any clue what they were doing (with drinks or with your cash), or had there actually been a table bussing once in the 4 hours my friends were there, this place would have made 4 stars. An admittedly eclectic jukebox blaring at mind-twisting levels was also a problem (this place does NOT qualify for my famed list of Top 5 Places For Acceptable Hearing Loss).

It has potential, but it's got its fair share of problems. Let's try it again in one year and see what happens.
author: Tolga E.

description:
My new home.  Kidding.  Across the street from my new home, though.  Where to begin.  First of all, I love that no matter WHAT TIME OF DAY you go in there will invariably be a small group of Euros on the left side of the bar who are already kind of drunk.  It seems to me also that the bartenders are usually drunk, and in high spirits.  

Plus, the decor is really cozy I think.  It doesn't feel like a dive bar at all.  It feels very proper, but yet remains a very proper place to get shitty.

**Umm.  Apparently what formerly appeared in this space caused some trouble for the person to which it referred.  Great.  Does this mean I'm 86'ed from yet ANOTHER bar?  And this time for trying to say something nice?  I swear, I just can't get a break in this town.  I really didn't mean any harm.**
author: Coco D.

description:
My new found haven for future happy hour activities...  I can't believe I had never come here before despite me and Bacchus both being residents of the same neighborhood.

This place has EVERYTHING, EVERYTHING I need and look for in a dive: Pool table, jukebox with excellent music, a smoke room, and a quite un-divey decor (cabin-like structure with clean counter/tables).  On my first visit I think it went a little too perfectly that it felt like a dream.

As the music played in the background (from Killers to Britney, from Dr. Dre to Hendrix), I devoured my Katsu Don bought from across the street (Sushi Rika , which can be my next review) with a cold Bass.  The mood was chill like a summer breeze.

I'm all yours now, Bacchus my love.
author: Jiajia C.

description:
We didn't stay long because my friends are drunken whores, but Bacchus Kirk is a cozy, well-kept bar. I will definitely go back and give it a fuller try.

After all, one of my drunken, whorish friends found a lovely "lay over." That's inspirational!
author: Brad C.

description:
This place used to be a great neighborhood bar. A loungy, old school, for lack of a better word, dive, with a fish tank. The bartenders were a little rough around the edges, and knew how to hold a conversation with any customer (striped, button up, collar shirt not required). 

Not sure what happened but now its a generic, hipster/GAP kid, dj-type club with zero character. Red lights, formulaic, trite minimalist decor, watered down drinks, and single serving patrons that act like they've been going there for years. You might as well be in North Beach or the Marina.

...and whatever happened to that hallucinogenic poster of the sea creature in the men's room?
author: Brian R.

description:
This place gets points for being close to my apartment (though uphill) and having the same last name as me. 

I dig the atmosphere and even sometimes the overloud jukebox. The bartenders are usually attentive and quick, though one has either forgotten or refused on multiple occasions to bring me water. Oh, and I got third place in a pubquiz here once while barely trying, so can't complain about that.
author: James K.

description:
I like this place alot. The bartenders there rock! Mike is one of a kind fucking funny as all get out, Brit. is a sweetheart, Fiona is always pleasent with a big smile, Sharon tares it up back there and makes drinks fast, but my favorite bartender there by far is Pamella. She was my prodigy, my student. She will kill it behind the bar and for sure make you feel welcome any time she is working. I must say in all the years teaching, she has come full circle of what a bartender should bring to the table. 

Now about the place itself, very cozy, good music, and pool table. I love the concept of the the smoking room offset from the inside, (yet inside sorta)  

Behind the bar- Very CLEAN!!  
You want a drink, you will find it here, atleast you could, not too long ago. The Signature drinks they have there are worth trying.  

All in all give this place a shot, I would not just say that about this place but I cant help it.  Way better than the Cellar one block over...
author: T S.

description: I like this place a lot! We came on Sunday night before July 4th, and the place was pretty slow, but while it may be slow, the bartender is super quick and helpful with drinks. It's just got a really good vibe and drinks are about $8 each so good price too. The place is kinda small with a pool table at the end. It's perfect to hangout with friends and grab a drink and relax. AND the music is not too loud, so makes for easy conversation. Awesome =)
author: Derek X.

description: This was as classy as a dive bar gets. Great atmosphere. Loved the Irish bartendress who IDed me. Good drink selection and *gasp* a happy hour. Easy to chill, plenty of seating. I will frequent. Will you?
author: Andrew K.

description: I end up in here every few weeks because this is my friend's usual haunt. It's pretty awesome, very laid back and I've never seen it packed. It draws a calmer crowed so the vibe lends itself to that calm feeling. Not too shabby if you just want to chat with a friend without having to scream over some element.
author: Shauna S.

description: Came here last and it's a nice comfy bar to kick back and catch up with friends. It was pretty busy when we got in but the bartender was still friendly and quick. I like that there's plenty of seating and there's a huge selection of music to choose from on the juke box. I only got beer so I can't say anything about their special mixed drinks. It's cozy, loungy but not TOO loungy, divey but not a total dive... just a fun place to chill, people watch, and enjoy a few drinks.
author: Queenie C.

description:
A place to have a drink or two (or three) with your favorite pals. It has the ambiance of a ski lodge (complete with fireplace) but has an edge to it. [read: all kinds of people come here -- art students from the art academy, retired couple, occasional tourist, your professionals, etc]

They just added a smoke room (in the front) so you smokers don't have to go out into the cold. 

A great neighborhood bar (Nob Hill) that will hopefully be around for a long time!
author: Vanessa J.

description:
"Nice remodeling job. 

Bambi went with Bunny and a few guests recently and Bunny was on a mission for a date. So as a good friend would do ... Bambi started casing the Bar for a candidate and got lucky with Mr Radio. (keep reading it gets interesting I hope). 

So Mr RADIO starts chatting up with Bunny which left Bambi to wonder about in the bar and the other guests to join. So here we are a few drinks and a pool game or two and Mr RADIO decides to invite everyone up the block to his apartment.

We finish our drinks and say bye to the lovely Chandra and head off to the Apt. We go inside and we are told to sit and enjoy while Mr Radio has to go get his boom box at which point he also mentions his mother is asleep in the bedroom and has taken enough pills to knock her out to the next millennium. Door opens and we are like where is Mr Radio going?... 20 minutes go by and Mr radio is back but this time thru the bedroom doors... At which point Bunny says...

"Bambi I think Mr Radio broke into the neighbors  Apt to get the Boom Box. We better get out of dodge before the police show up..."

Run Bambi Run ... with that we are back to Bacchus telling the story and scouting for another date. 

Back to the real deal... the bar has a pool table and a fireplace.. how cute. Drinks are priced well and the girls behind the bar are industry veterans. You know what they say "the Irish can drink" and let me tell you these girls can drink anyone under the table."
author: Teddy d.

description: Chill, relaxed atmosphere. Drinks can get rather steep, but it's like that in this area.
author: Jorge H.

description:
Pooltable, jukebox, fireplace, stiff drinks, solid bartenders, and all wrapped up within a lower nob ski lodge.

One of my favs in the hood.
author: Dpb T.

description:
It's like your upscale alcoholic huntin' shack with a great happy hour. The music is good, the decor is homey, and beer selection is above average. Drinks were average stiffness.

Watch out, Tuesday is Trivia Nite and the organizers are Scientology-pushy about trying to get you play if you linger past happy hour.
author: Matt L.

description:
I would give this place 5 stars but I was kicked out once...not my fault (of course) and we have since settled this little misunderstanding. lol
