But seriously, this has been my semi-neighborhood bar for almost 2 years and I love it.  

Pros:
Strong Margs
Fellas with Irish accents
Pool table (huge plus)
Jukebox
Fireplace
Friendly bartenders

Cons:
People erasing names off of the pool-table-chalkboard
Shady happenings in the ladies room (always more than 1 person in that stall for some reason) - yikes
Cougars...they wander in from time to time ;)

So all in all, it's a pretty fun place.  If you have someone asking "where is a fun place to go to just hang out, play pool, drink beers all afternoon and perhaps perform a rendition of Michael Flatley's greatest dance moves "...well here is your answer.
author: Carlyna R.

description:
If you're looking for a bar at Bush & Taylor in SF, this one works.

I liked it.  Nice small location, good layout of the bar, tables/chairs, pool table , and jukebox.  Not ridiculously dark, good interior.

The Cadillac margarita was pretty good, the pomegranate margarita was eh.  Thumbs up to this place for having Guinness and Boddingtons beers.

The crowd was mostly the 20s/30s bunch.  The bartenders were nice enough and kept things moving quick.   It's a nice little bar.
author: Charles R.

description: Only had one drink in here, so I can't give a full on review.  Bacchus is located within walking distance the the Marriott where I was staying, and the bartender was a super-cool Brit that turned me onto the Mission district.
author: Troy S.

description:
Is it even possible to have a bad time at the Bacchus? Perhaps it's the people I come here with (BK regulars) but this place gets rowdy in a very UK way. michelle i is right, this place looks like a converted ski lodge on the inside, which helps you forget you're in the city, which is why you're there. Jukebox is good, drinks are generously portioned, pool in the back, smokers now on display in the front in a plexiglas box. Graffiti in the bathroom makes embarrassing claims about various people but I can't verify they're true so no points off.

Fiona is a great bartender. Treat her well and she will return the favor.
author: andy d.

description:
While it is true that I am biased, I really like the bar and the people.
The staff is friendly and mostly Scottish/Irish/British.  There's a fireplace, pool table, cool music, Happy Hour (badly-needed drink discount specials) and they allow DOGS.  One full star just for the dogs.

Trivia Tuesday at 9:00 featuring ME as DJ (thus the bias) but I like the Bacchus vibe and the Bacchus staff even on Wednesdays.

The locals are a friendly lot too. 
No food, but you can bring it in.
And did I mention the dogs.
author: Chuck B.

description:
I've been to Bacchus Kirk twice now, both times for post-work adult beverages.  I really like the cozy atmosphere, and perhaps since I was there fairly early (6-9pm) it's never been too busy.  This could be why I found the service much faster than some other reviewers, but honestly I wouldn't have minded.  Both of the bartenders were very cool, talkative, and attentive.  In fact, last night we shared a free shot with the bartender -- it tasted exactly like an oatmeal cookie.  Fantastic.

As for drinks, I'm not that adventurous.  I stick with vodka and cranberry usually, and all the ones I was served here were perfectly fine.  However, my British friend who introduced me to this place loves that they serve Magnus cider (which tastes quite good over ice, really).

Last night I tried the smoking room out, which I hadn't even noticed on my first visit, and it was interesting.  I appreciate its existence, but I don't see how it could be legal.  Oh!  The bathroom was larger than I've seen elsewhere and much, much cleaner.

So, overall 5 stars because it has everything I need in a bar, and the prices are standard for San Francisco.
author: Casey S.

description:
I like the log cabin ambiance here. The drinks are a bit lack luster but all in all it is a good place to hang out with friends. It is not too loud if you want to talk but isn't so quiet you are about to fall asleep. 

I have been here a couple times for small gatherings with friends. I would recommend it for a place where you just want to grab a drink and chill. Other than that I wouldn't expect too much.
author: Madeline T.

description:
This place has Iggy Pop on the juke box so you know it can't be that bad...

I've been here a few times to shoot pool and it seems the best bet for that in the neighborhood.  The table in back is nicely situated so that you don't have to bump into other drinkers while you're getting your game on.  The regulars also seem pretty cool, even when you beat them like 9 games in a row.  Some of them will even buy you shots, but that could be because they're trying to throw you off your game.
author: Steve H.

description:
Bacchus is 1 of 2 watering holes that I've considered to be my "locals" since moving to SF (the other being Murio's Trophy Room).  And when I say local, I mean that I went here almost every single day, knew all the bartenders, all the other locals, and spent copious amounts of money here.  Nowadays I only make it there once every couple of months, but it still manages to rock my booty!  The bartenders are always friendly (especially when you're a regular), they make stiff drinks, and the crowd is a good mix of people.  Pretty decent juke box as well!  
Do I miss Bacchus because it was like a second home (sleet, snow, or rain I was there), or do I hate Bacchus for not being in my current hood?  I miss it...
author: Zev K.

description: Seriously, it's been well over a year.  If time can't mend my anger over this terrible service, this shouldn't be a 2 star place.
author: Sam H.

description:
I remember liking this bar quite a bit.  I haven't been back though.  In fact I forgot that it existed.  

Must check up to see if it lives up to the half-remembered revelries of a year ago.   I remember it being chill, dark, divey, with good drinks and bartenders.
author: Heidi P.

description: Stop in for a beer but it's nothing special. Typical neighborhood bar. Drinks are a bit pricey and I believe most of the cooler bartenders either moved on or were let go.
author: Marc B.

description: If you want slow service without a hello, come here. If not, don't. We waited at least 10 minutes for even a "what would you like to drink?".
author: Andy A.

description:
We stopped by for after-work drinks and came before the happy hour started! That's a first for me. Happy hour is currently from 7-9pm with a buck off taps and some discount on other drinks. Nothing crazy but a good deal. It was a bit slow to begin with and it could be a little hard to get the bartender's attention as she was busy with a private conversation in the corner of the bar. Didn't bother me too much, but thought I'd mention it as it's the only minus I have.

The jukebox is amazing. From TuPac to Postal Service, it hit home with our team.

We thought we wanted to get out of there before the trivia started but ended up getting sucked in and we had a blast. But what's up with the group of 15 "pro's" that show up *just* for the trivia and leaves right after? Kind of unfair to us random teams with memories partially blanked by the happy hour...

But I digress. We had a great night, we didn't play to win and we'll certainly be back again.
author: Jesper J.

description: Comfy, Cool, with a sexy crowd. A great place to go for a quiet pint with a date or to get rat-arsed with the lads. I give it double thumbs up!!
author: Johnny N.

description:
What can I say - I practically live here.  I do my Dodgeball friends a favor by not checking in everytime I go to this place (for the last few months, it's been pretty much every day; some days several times a day).

The BK employees rock.  The bar itself kicks ass (well, they recently re-finished the floors, and they still haven't put the foot-pole back on the bar yet, so that blows.  And I won't even go into the loss I felt when they closed for the 2.5 days it took to re-finish).  They have a tiny little smoking room though I don't use it.  

The regulars: great group of people.  The non-regulars: for the most part, not too shabby.  

They have nuts and chips as far as food goes.  If they served real food, I'd REALLY be in trouble.  But there's plenty around if you want to go get some to bring in (or even have it delivered to you there) - and BK is very food friendly.  I usually hit up Cybelle's Pizza just up the street and bring a few slices in with me.

Oh, and they're dog friendly, too.  I don't recommend bringing them with you when it's super-busy inside, but otherwise feel free.  My 90lb boy is usually treated to a dog biscuit or two and even some water if it looks like he needs it by the great tenders they have there.

So stop by and check it out!  Say Hi to me while you're there!  Sometimes I do go home and take a nap from 5:30 to about 7:30, but I eventually make my way back.  And I'm getting better at not closing the place down during the work week...

Two point five thumbs up and five stars from me!!
author: Fluffy B.

description:
One of my more preferred pseudo-dive bar establishments in Nob Hill.  The jukebox is good times - mostly British music, which shouldn't surprise anyone since most of the people in the place are from the UK.  

The place is owned (last I heard) by a woman named Sharon, who also owned O'Farrell St Bar, but I think she sold it.  I may be talking out of my ass there, but that's what I'd heard.

Anyway, they just added a smoking room not too long ago, which is helpful because it seems like most of the people who frequent the place smoke.  

Pool table in the back, though only one - so it's tough to get on.  The atmosphere is very red - red lamps and very dark.  Good selection of scotch and plenty of seating.  

Definitely my favorite neighborhood bar - a little bit dive, a little bit posh, if that's possible.
author: Adam C.

description: Went here for the happy hour.  The bartender wasn't too happy she had to make cocktails instead of pouring beer.  I could TASTE how unhappy she was in every sip of my weak-ass drink.
author: stephany m.

description:
Bacchus has a great feel to it.  Dim lighting, a fireplace with cushions around it so you can warm up your personalities, and a little smoking room.  Pool table in the back, decent jukebox.

There is one glaring problem with this place:  The bartenders are total slackasses.  

Seriously I think that the employee handbook says "If there is a full bar, and people are standing there waving arms and holding empty glasses and $20 bills, All Bacchus Kirk employees must make sure to stand in the corner and chat with each other whilst doing their very best to ignore everyone else"  I've been bartending for about 4 years now, and I can safely say that there is absolutely no excuse for this.
author: Jason L.

description:
Good drinks, great jukebox, and great decor.
Indoor smoking, good looking crowd, friendly service.
author: Enrique A.

description: Cozy place with cool wooden floors and a fireplace. I've only been here once and I had a Duvel. It didn't blow me away as being particularly unique, but I would definitely come here again.
author: Jade S.

description: Came here for happy hour with a friend on a Friday evening. Decent crowd but not crazy packed. Bartender was super friendly and she dealt well with a dramatic yelling match that happened between two patrons. My friend had his small dog with us, and she came inside without any problem from the bartender, also. They had a pool table in the back, and happy hour was until 9pm. Can't beat that!
author: Anne A.

description:
pretty stoked to have this bar right down the street from me.

looooove the wood cabin vibe, complete with fireplace.  awesome place to relax & warm up in the heart of the city.  annnddd...they even offer free pizza most nights during happy hour! never really packed, it's a great bar to chill out at.

could do without the boys at the pooltable that stare as you walk to the bathroom, but...they're decidedly harmless.
author: Kyle F.

description: The Kirk is a really comfortable neighborhood bar with exceptional ambiance (read: I, personally, look much better in the dark, so am devilishly handsome here ... especially after you've had a couple). There is always a merry group of low-key revelers to keep the vibe nice, but it's still a pleasant, conversation-conducive spot if that's what you're seeking.
author: Gregor G.

description: My Irish hot mom. Yup. That's the bartender in this place, my hard drinkin', drink slingin' surrogate mother. I've just adopted her now. And she runs a pretty sweet bar: comfy benches along the side, a fireplace, pool table and it's totally dark and comfy. I barely even know what neighborhood this is, otherwise I'd be up here more often throwing back beers with my friends.
author: Michael E.

description: My new favorite bar. I went there on Saturday night and had no trouble finding a table for me and a friend. Pros: unpretentious, comfortable atmosphere, warm fireplace, what looked to be a decent pool table, friendly bartender who gave us an awesome deal on drinks, the best music I've heard in a bar in a long time, no douchebags in sight. Why haven't I been here before?
author: Kari B.

description: I never knew this strip of bars on Sutter street existed before! Went to a friend's farewell work party here and really liked the vibe of the place. Good space, not too crowded and a pool table. Not quite a dive but not pretentious either. Me likey.
author: Cathy T.

description:
I have been to this bar before with a friend that lives across the street and it has been "ok".  But since then it has definitely taken a turn for the worse.  We were meeting a group of friends there to hang out, play pool, and watch the Giants game on their low def tvs.  Me and my friend were the first there and ordered drinks.  Right off the bat I could tell this bartender had a chip up her ass... with a negative "what do you want from me" attitude.  I shrugged it off and put down my credit card to start a tab.  While pouring my drink she asked for our id's.  I showed my CA id and my friend showed her International identity card.  Both of us are over 21.  The bartender didn't take my friend's ID.  So my friend said "fine I'll just have a water"  But the bartender said "no, you have to leave now."   Then I said "fine we are leaving then."  I tried to get my credit card back but she wouldn't give it back to me unless I paid for the beer she already poured.   The beer was still sitting on the bar and I never even touched it.   I said "there was no way I am going to drink a beer while you kick my friend out.  Give me my card back"  She still refused and threatened to charge the $15 minimum charge on credit cards.  I then said I would call the cops in 2 minutes if she didn't give it back to me.  After more attitude and bitching from her she finally gave it back to me and said "your 86'd from this bar"  Haha.... don't worry sweetheart there is no way me or my friends will be giving this bar business again.   BTW if anyone from this bar is reading this.... you lost a lot of business that night from the group of 10 people that were going to go there that night.  Your loss.

 If you want a moldy bar to serve you drinks with attitude then this is the place to go.
author: Patrick H.

description: I like to stop into this bar on my way home from work, and have always enjoyed it. I like to sit at the bar and have a couple beers while talking to the great bartenders. I've gone in on some weekends nights and didn't care for the crowded atmosphere, but then again I rarely enjoy a full bar. A smoking room is a big plus!!!
author: Ken H.

description:
There are times in my life where I have earned a few nicknames-- heartbreaker, vixen, maneater, etc. There are a few places I frequent where I come with a disclaimer. There are also a few places that I feel I can no longer return to do dating blunders, falling outs or just plain "oopsies". Sadly this is one of them....

I enjoyed my visits to this bar. I really liked talking to the bartenders. The Irish lady and I had a great time making fun of my drunk Southern accent (drunk I was, Southern, sadly I'm not). She said it was easier to understand to me in my faux hick drawl. I love her already for encouraging my drunken shenanigans!! I had a great time talking to my fellow CalPoly alumni who not only had been friends of friends but also discussed the weird infectous nature of "Sexyback" (you don't have to like the song or even really know you're listening to it but you'll find yourself moving to the beat of the music--I'm sure more than one bartender will agree with this). I enjoyed the patrons, the ski lodgy vibe, the beer and some interesting memories that I will hold near and dear to me. Maybe one day I'll have the guts to come back here. No apologies are in order but potential awkwardness may await me. Oh well, that's why they serve alcohol in bars right?
author: Veronica G.

description: Neat little late happy hour spot. It's nice that the happy hour is actually 7-9 pm, and the drinks for it are delicious!I had a pomegranate martini and a raspberry drop, both yummy. Jukebox, pool table, etc. Nice neighborhood and a chill crowd.
author: Irene F.

description: This place is so beautiful for a chill bar. The atmosphere is nice, the clientele seems good, the service was decent. Pool table in back wasn't totally packed the whole time on a Monday night, but there was enough traffic to keep it interesting. Looking forward to going back.
author: Monika M.

description:
saturday  night we dropped into bacchus kirk.  john's mate owns the bar, and invited us to their event that evening.  they were previewing their new cocktails, and all the featured cocktails were complimentary from 8-9pm. 

bacchus kirk, located in nob hill, reminds me of a sultry lodge you'd imagine in a ski town of lake tahoe or jackson hole.  the lights are dim with red hues, the interior is wooden, and of course there is the token fire place.  they placed a huge chalkboard in the back so the art students at the nearby college would stop marking up the bathroom walls, and display their work on the board.  there is an enclosed smoking area, which helps brace the cold on those windy san francisco nights.  my favorite are the huge mirrors that are framed by old 2x4 boards, c.1920's or so.
author: Sheri N.

description: Yet another pubtrivia review for Tuesdays.  This is your basic pubtrivia with two general trivia rounds, a picture round and the dreaded music round.  The prizes are cash and the crowd is mix.
author: Amber L.

description: Came here for a friend's birthday. Good drinks, reasonable prices for the city. It was awesome that they had a juke box that you could pick songs on ($5 for 18 songs or $1 for 3 songs). My friends had fun playing pool. Got a weeee bit crowded with all of us but we were a large party. Though we weren't there in time for it - the happy hour seemed like a great deal, goes all the way till 8pm every day of the week! Parking was a nightmare but what else can you expect from the city on a Saturday night.
author: Dana H.

description: this place lets my friend Kirk bring his dog Rocky in for beers- that scores a perfect 5 on my list!  They have triva night on Tuesdays that is fun.  Usually a fun laid back crowd a good place to get the night started!
author: rachel c.

description:
i LOVE this bar.  my sister lives in the neighborhood and it's always our "go to" place whenever I spend the night at her apartment.  The bartenders have been supercool and friendly everytime i've been.

I prefer the offnights going in for a beer, enjoying the fireplace, pool table and their juke box is good too...

And by the way, if the rumors about getting rid of trivia tuesdays are true I'm going to be really sad!
author: Nicki F.

description: Bitchy English cnt bartender just bnned me for not putting up with her boyfriend. First he comes on to me, then when I tell him I'm straight and not interested becomes insulting and challenges me to go outside for a fight. He doesn't go outside, but she kicks me out apparently for not being gay and English like he is. She sucks, he sucks, and I'm not going back.
author: Pete A.

description:
what can i say about the BK? good prices, good selection (they have guinness - a must), complete with a juke box and pool table - it's like home away from home. 

the dim lighting and ski-lodge meets dive bar feel provides for a comfy place to hang out. i used to live across the place and loved stumbling home afterwards!
author: Jill L.

description: Trivia night. Ski lodge atmosphere with functioning fireplace and trianglular wooden roof. Pool table with nice folks. Great Irish bartenders. Smoking patio up front. Jukebox. Random hipsters jivin' to the Bee Jees, or punks watchin' them in digust. Not too pricey. Cheers!
author: Braden B.

description: THIS was a great Yelp success story. I had to meet my boyfriend and a couple of friends in this hood and I looked up places on Yelp, and this place was a wonderful find. It's walking distance from Market (yes, up hills) but the environment, and even the people seemed pleasant and non-pretentious enough. It has a very cozy feel, and the 'tender was friendly, and efficient. I had Piper Sonoma Sparkling, which is decent stuff and it was $7.  -Don't find that much in other places.  But this was a week day, so who knows on a weekend!
author: Cristian M.

description: Good neighborhood bar with decent prices for drinks....although I am not overly impressed with the jukebox selections.  I like the ski lodge atmosphere and will likely come back when its snowing back East.
author: Amy Z.

description: Great place to watch Dutch World Cup matches. They were rapidly running out of just about every beer they have on tap, but the nice sized group of oranje supporters made it worth while.
author: Andrew L.

description: Pretentious name, not place. Very cozy. Reddish lighting. Fireplace. Has a lodge feel. Perfect for warming up on a nippy day.
author: Matt M.

description:
So, I just moved to the city and people have recommended yelp to find great bars in the city.  My co-workers and I came to Bacchus a few weeks ago and I think I've found my new neighborhood bar.  The bar was pretty busy and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.  I really enjoyed the fire place and the warm atmosphere.

The hot Asian bartender was very attentive and by our conversations she seemed to be very intelligent as well.  The smoke room was very convienent because it was freezing outside!!  They also have a pool table and a nice selection of songs on the juke box.

You can bet I'll be back because I live just down the street... No DUI for me!
author: Scott O.

description:
i was in the neighborhood last night and decided to stop in since i had some time to kill.  kind of dark but cozy with tables, a jukebox and a pool table.  i sat at the bar and noticed the fruity but tasty sounding drinks listed on the wall.  i stuck to beer since i had plans but i will be back for happy hour again, especially since it goes until 9, and maybe for trivia night.

in the half hour i was there, i met a half korean guy from georgia with a southern accent who was almost given an unfortunate name and some lady analyzing the definition of slut.  it was fun.  if i lived nearby, i think i would be there all the time.
author: Seong P.

description:
So about a year ago, my friends and I were moseying (is that even a word?) ok sashaying (ditto)...ok fine...we were walking down Bush looking for a decent place to shoot some pool and grab a drink that wouldn't include staring at a tranny hooker from across the bar...Lo and behold Bacchus Kirk.  

The bar itself...eh its a bar.  They do have a fireplace which is nice in winter (it gets Burning Man hot in there at times) and they do have a pool table, which is part of the reason that I have made it my local home.  There is a jukebox with a good collection of music from the-grass-is-so-emo-it-cuts-itself type to your standard I-sing-about-jail-but-never-really-did-time Johnny Cash.  Crowds are always cool; I have never seen any fights.  I did see a couple of tools arguing with each other once, but honestly Asian ladies fighting over the same scarf at Marshall's are more vicious.  Oh by the way, the douche from the earlier review that got 86-ed because he did fight there, STFU.  Grow a dick and find another bar to flex your compensatory muscles at.  I'm glad you aren't at my local.  Anyway, I digress...there is a cool little smoking room just off the doorway which always has entertaining conversation.  As a warning the bar is a pub crawl destination on some nights (and who could blame em?), so crowds get a bit deep somtimes around 9pm, but come on, its San Francisco, get used to it.  

I will say that my favorite nights to go are Wednesdays because of Mike.  Seriously, if Jesus Christ had taken up serving drinks instead of that miracle-thing, well he would have been a helluva bartender.  Mike run's a close second.  I love this guy.  No really, like serious bro-mance.  He always gets my drinks quick, knows what I want and is always in a good mood.  Plus he has cool hair - man is this going to be awkward next Wednesday.  Ok, ok...I also really love George (female, dont worry) and Fiona (she's sweet) and Pamela (she's Brazzilian and hot! My girlfriend is going to kill me...love you babe *meow*) and Siobahn who guest-bartends every now and again and well frankly everyone there...they are all between 3s and 5s on the coolness scale...10 being max.  Just kidding guys...dont spit in my Stella!  Seriously though, if you are looking for a local joint to shoot some pool and grab a cold one, this is your place.
author: Mark C.

description: Bacchus Kirk was cool for the most part and I'll definitely  be stopping here again. The jukebox is pretty solid, unless you get someone, like we did, who plays 3 Rage Against the Machine songs in a row. That was pretty annoying. Anyway, my cocktail was great but I switched to beer to slow down since we were getting up super early the next morning. Most people were pretty friendly, they have a little smoking room in the front so you don't have to brave the windy cold, and it seemed as though you could bring in take out food. Hopefully I'll make it back here this week/end.
author: Natalie G.

description: Still kicks A** and I love Camilla, Mike, Pam, Fiona and Louise. In no particular order!!! : ))
author: lisa v.

description: The Kirk, as we affectionately call it in my circle, is home to some and a mail drop for others in the 'hood.  I love the fire place and the wood walls.  Plus, the bartenders are fun.  They finally got a decent juke box now too.  Homey and central.  I love The Kirk.
author: Chard M.

description: Why did I think this was a wine bar??  Came here with some friends for Friday happy hour and I was a bit surprised to walk in and find a dive bar.  Not disappointed, just surprised.  There is a pool table at the back of the bar which I did not partake in during this visit, but good to know for future reference.  The bartender was super nice and actually gave my friend a smoke as she had had a pretty rough day.  They have a well-ventilated, convenient smoking area at the front of the bar for those so inclined.  I'd definitely come back for a post-work drink.
author: Michelle L.

description: What a great neighborhood bar! It has a very cozy/lodge feeling. The wine selection wasn't great, but the service was wonderful. A great local neighorhood bar! They have great happy hour prices!
author: Suzie Y.

description: This is a great neighborhood dive bar. The place has a cozy cabin-like interior with a fireplace, pool table and jukebox in the back. I like that its unpretentious with a good mix of people, all ready to just chill and have a good time. Definitely a great happy hour spot too.
author: Leen K.

description: There is nothing wrong with this little place.  I like the seats by the fireplace and the music selection and the decor is nice and the lighting is subdued. And I like the name which I have a hard time remembering.  I'm just bitter because I had way too many beers to be charming and consequently and deservedly struck out this evening.  I think I tried to hit on this girl in Portuguese and she didn't like my translation. My apologies to members of the female race.
author: Cassio P.

description: I know it is going to be a long nite when I start my bar crawl here. This bar is not too much of any one thing. The music on the juke box is well rounded and the bartenders are friendly. The feeling in here is relaxed neighborhood bar that is not divey.
author: Charise B.

description: I don't know if it was the bartender's accent, or just a spur-of-the-moment decision, but I found myself nursing a pint of Guiness, which is a rare choice for me.  The happy hour is a convenient time, 7-9, so it's easy to make it after work.  I got my rear-end handed to me in a couple of games of pool, but that's too be expected.  I like the long bar; it's condusive to socializing and the crowd was solid.  There's a fireplace, which adds some homey flare and they're showing all of the World Cup Soccer games.  Yet another great neighborhood bar to frequent.
author: ellyk E.

description: I loved it! Probably because I prefer less crowded bars that actually give you something to do, like chose music from the jukebox or play (more like suck at)  or watch pool. This is a great place to go and relax. There wasn't much of a crowd, so co-mingling with other bar persons is highly unlikely but I'd definitely be back and I'm putting in my list of favs.
author: Cassy R.

description: As this is now practically the only surviving bar within a 2 block walk from my home habitat that has not been taken over by the Academy of Art leeches, I consider it a treasure. The bartenders are great, very friendly and the vibe is more neighborhood like than Nob Hill snoothood like. Good place to have a pint, sit in a corner under a red lightbulb and look mysterious...
author: Megan W.

description: I really like the ambiance of this place. Its got kinda cabin-y wood lodge feel to it. Very warm and comfortable. I've been twice for their trivia nights on Tuesdays (which is quite fun since I'm a trivia whore). Their happy hour drinks are pretty good too. And parking (on a Tuesday) has been surprisingly easy. I doubt I'd come back for any night besides Trivia Night,  since the crowd is pretty Nob Hill-ish.
author: Rocky K.

description: If you are looking for one of the best filthy martinis in town, go see Mandy. No seriously, she knows how to make a drink, always has a smile on, and is generally just kick ass. Not only do I love this bar for its proximity to my house, but even better they let me bring my dog in, and they rarely have the flat screen tvs blaring sports, or sports center, or some other sports thing at me.  They have a great selection of booze, a damn good selection on the jukebox and seating galore. Its a wonderful place to waste a Sunday afternoon, and I promise if Mandy is behind the bar you won't be disappointed!
author: Jenny E.

description: I am not sure how to review this place as I have no strong feelings one way or the other. I like to stop in for drinks now and then, but I am not really a fan of the music (too loud). If they turned it down a little and added some more comfy seats this place could be an awesome lounge.
author: Kate M.

description:
I agree with Sam H.  I used to love this bar but that "little metro bartender" ruined for me.  1:45 am rolls around and he's yelling at everybody from behind the bar: "Let's go, people!  Finish your drinks!  C'mon, time to go people!"  To Sam H's point, if he would've asked a little nicer, I would've been cool with it.  (Instead, I knocked over my beer and got into a yelling match with him.)

The problem is, this bar is great.  I love it.  It's chill, never packed, and the music is good. But the bartender sucks.  Not all of them, just that one.

Still, I do recommend this place, but make sure you leave early if he's working, unless you want to be ushered out of the bar like a homeless person on a door step.

What a shame. What a waste. As a host, you should treat your guests with respect and you will get respect in return.
author: Nicholas H.

description: I have been to Bacchus Kirk several times and have always had a great time.  Great atmosphere, great people, and oh yeah -great drinks.  Try one of their signature drinks on the board the Mellow Mango is delish.  Or if you see Tim the bartender (crazy fun guy behind the bar) ask him suprise you & whip you something up - I have never been let down.  And dont forget quiz night.  They write their own so you dont feel like you are getting the same everyday pubquiz that everyone else is.  Check it out for yourself, you wont be dissapointed.
author: Sara Ann S.

description: Went for a drink here last night before a wedding at the Memorial Club. It's a cool little spot. If you're in the neighborhood definitely worth checking out.  This area is becoming a good area to bar hop - with Cantina, Owl Tree, Sugar Cafe, White Horse Tavern - it's now getting to be a good destination for going out.
author: Sarah R.

description: Tonight, was my first time to Bacchus Kirk, the decor was spot on for this Nob Hill sleeper...The bartender was quite friendly but a bit slow with making a mixed cocktail, but hell it was a Monday night!  The wood and the exposed brick gave me a warm feeling of being home or back on the East Coast, while sipping on my scotch and listening to classic indie track.  I was impressed with the jukebox selection and the fact that the bar has a pool table, "Perfecto" if your rolling solo or with a drinking buddy. A hidden Jewel amongst the random bars traversing up snob hill.  I think I found my new watering hole, away from home!!
author: jonathan b.

description: While its definitely not the coolest bar in the city, Bacchus Kirk is very cozy.  It has a large fireplace in the middle of the dark bar which creates an atmosphere perfect for a deep chat with a close friend.  Or get all your friends together and take over the bar.  The jukebox is decent and for those of you who fancy pool, there is a table in the back.  But it seems to be very popular. So expect a wait.
author: Alexis M.

description: While I do not appreciate the clientele here, I must say that for my neighborhood bar it's rather nicely appointed -- good atmosphere, good drinks, and nice staff.
author: Darren M.

description: From the outside it looks like a dive and from the inside smells like a dive but the music, lighting and art on the inside make up for it.  This is a great little bar and so close to my house.  Great Music..yes, I too love Oasis.
author: Kattya B.

description:
this place gets five stars b/c there's a dog, jake, that runs around here.  i'm a total dog person (currently sans-canine), and that's probably more of what influenced my obsession with this place than anything else =).  

seriously though, it's got really cute decor (w/ a fireplace!) and there're pool tables in the back.  cheap happy hour deals on martinis - and happy hour goes pretty late - 8 or 9 i think.
author: Alexis W.

description: Dim and local, pool table in the back, and a smoking glasshouse (with an open window onto the street). It does not, however, feel like a dive bar -- the decor is definitely... upscale rustic (?). The bar selection, prices, and service were all average. Very easy-going, never too crowded or too loud (though there can be a crowd on the busiest nights), and perfect if you're just in the area, need a night-cap, or are in the mood for a casual beer. If you're a local, come be a regular!
author: G. J.

description: Homey bar just keeping its head above Tendernob dive. Friendly bartenders and a nice local feeling make it the best "spittin' distance from home" bar for me. If the bar itself didn't look like a linoleum fake wood floor I'd maybe bump up the rating.
author: Chris S.

description: A great little neighborhood bar. Pool table in the back, slowish but friendly service. And a great Tuesday night Trivia Contest. Although I may be biased because we came in second! Ha! Take that, third place bastards!
author: Tim B.

description: I went here recently with a bunch of coworkers that ranged in age from mid-20s to late-60s, and we all had a great time.  There really is something for everyone.  The jukebox had a variety of crowd-pleasers (from The Streets to Justin Timberlake).  The cocktails were tasty.  And it was a nice clean place with still a touch of a neighoborhood divey atmosphere.  Will definitely be going back for more Happy Hours.
author: Christina D.

description: First, ONE star because I live a block away.  Second, TWO stars because the most awesome bartender, MIKE works there. Third, ONE star because the juke box ROCKS my world.  Finally, LAST, but CERTAINLY not the least star goes to the pool table and all the reindeer games you can play here.
author: Rochelle B.

description:
in all fairness, i came here last night when i was pretty tired and not feeling like drinking. i had a couple of friends there who i hadn't seen in awhile, and felt like i should stop by to at least say hi. 

it's actually a pretty nice bar for the tenderloin area. i would categorize it as a trendy, local, dive bar. it had a nice chill atmosphere and a pool table in the back. i liked it cause it wasn't overly crowded but there was a good number of people there so that it didn't feel like we were the only ones. 

service was pretty friendly even though it seemed like there was only one girl there taking care of the whole bar, and although it wasn't crazy busy, they maybe could've used one more person, but then they probably wouldn't been bored. they were right on the cusp of needing one more person or having people wait a little, which for the type of place it is, i think it's okay. is seemed like quite a few people there were regulars and familiar with the bartender. 

i ordered an amstel light and it wasn't quite cold enough, not sure if it hadn't been in the fridge long, or they just don't have their fridge set to very cold. it was really warm inside, a little too hot for my liking, especially when i'm drinking. the music was fun, i think it's a jukebox, but it was a little loud. for a bar that's really just a mingling type place we had to shout at each other every time the music was playing which when i go to a place like that, i like the music playing but i don't like to have to shout. i just want to be able to chill with my friends, have a beer and chat with some good music in the background.
author: Angela W.

description: Went here for the first time a few days ago and was pleasantly surprised.  Drink are fairly priced, even though I only drank beer, but the Heff was $4.75, pretty average. Atmosphere is cool, and the particular night I went it wasnt too crowded. In addition, the jukebox seemed to offer some pretty good choices as well. One star off because I did try to go here once on the weekend and it was too damn full.
author: Vilen G.

description: I went here on a Monday night.  There were a few people at the bar and a few other playing pool in the back, but otherwise, my friends and I had two huge tables to ourselves.  For some reason, I kept expecting to smell smoke since I am from the east coast and this is the type of dive bar that would be so smoky that you would not be able to see without crying after a while.  Thank you, California's legal system.  There was not a single renegade smoker in the bar and I had a great time here.
author: Joanna S.

description: This is the perfect neighborhood pub. Great bartenders, great music, great regulars... plus the added bonus of a very nice happy hour to be throughly enjoyed by the fireplace.
author: kristin n.

description: With a name like Bacchus, you've already got me on the upbeat.  Luckily, BK doesn't disappoint except for--and let's just go ahead and get it out of the way--a crop of take-your-own-sweet-time bartenders.  That aside, the high ski-lodge wooden roof, fireplace, pool table, happy hour (which *begins* at 7pm), and conversation-friendly tables make it a nice little neighborhood staple.
author: MScott S.

description: It's like a bigger Zeki's... Great jute box, pool table, cool people. The bar tender was a complete bitch to my group of friends, but seemed to know and LOVE everyone else. She charged me two dollars for tap water...is that legal? Aside from her I loved the place! It is dark and as someone said has a ski lodge feel. There are a few TV's and a large fireplace. I would like to become more of a regular...then maybe the bar tender will want to be friend too.
author: Lisa K.

description: Great choice of music, great choice of drinks, pool table, smoking area for those who need it, nice bartenders, divey, but not too divey.  -1 star for not great toilets.
author: Sarah E.

description: Close to my house. No hipsters. No Marina dudes. Conditions are perfect.
author: Serena L.

description: I went here on a Thursday night fairly early (8ish) to meet some friends. We had a great time until about 9, when the place became completely packed. There was only one bartender. I give her credit, she was busting her ass, but it was impossible to get a drink.
author: Dan J.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar to go grab a drink at night during the weekday.  On Wed, there is trivia night and it is usually packed with people ready to have a good time.  Bar tenders are nice and the crowd is laid back.  I agree with the other reviews, it has a very home like feel to this place.
author: Charles C.

description: Was just there for a few beers with friends on a Sunday night but I really love the atmosphere with the fireplace and the pool table.  Nice selection of beers and the bartender was friendly.  It was fairly chill on a cold Sunday night other than the dancing referee outfit drunk girl who was playing some good Michael Jackson tunes at the jukebox.
author: K V.

description:
good lord, who cares about this place.  the truth is, the drinks are good, and different, but a bar is a bar is a bar.  Seriously, unless there are swings or free food, the only thing that really matters about a bar is the bartenders, ie how they make the drinks, and how happy they make you.  

I have been to bacchus on several occassions, and I think only once did I have quasi- ok service.  The other times the bartenders seemed drunk or high and really did not care take care of us.  On one occasion (trying to get out of the place because I was sick of waiting), i actually had to wait for the bartender to finish her smoke outside, then talk to some friends by the pool table before she even got to me.  AND, i sure hope multi-tasking is not put down as qualifications on their resume.  Most times I have been there they literally take ONE drink order, take 10 minutes to make the drink then take one more drink order, even if you are ordering in groups, don't expect to order all at once, it's one at a time here.

So I like the atmosphere and drinks, I just can't handle the feeling that I am ruining the bartenders night when asking for said drink.
author: Brigid R.

description: it's friendly in here!  we were digging the cabin vibe, the pool table and the 90s music and sipping on some $6 mojitos.  the bartender even mixed me up a peach mojito since i can't tolerate too much minty-crap in my drink.  i just wish she would have also put some rum in there!  weakest drinks ever.  stick to a draft beer i think.  i'll be back another time to hang with the locals.
author: Holly B.

description: a lovely little bar with a ski-lodge feeling? or maybe i'm way off but that's what it felt like to me for some reason.... i just signed a lease for a new place close by and will be moving over here in just a few weeks. i wanted to stop in and check it out.... yeah, i'm so happy! i loved the energy in here immediately. they also seem to have some very friendly and heavy-handed drink-pouring bartenders. i have this feeling bacchus kirk will be my new neighborhood hangout... will edit later when i have a reeeeally good story.
author: Michelle I.

description: cozy sausage party, good for friends. terrible jukebox. smoking room is fun. bouncers joke like drunk uncles.
author: C S.

description: decent bar. very diverse crowd sometimes. lots of foreign hostel kids, which could be pleasant or annoying. friendly staff - although slow at times. any jukebox that has oasis, stone roses, and primal scream is ok with me! they've got a pool table. recently, they built a little smoking room in the front, but it's fairly tiny and i'd rather go outside to smoke. the bar always has smells of bleach though ... kinda annoying.
author: James J.

description: This is my favorite bar in my neighborhood. They have drink specials from 7-9pm on weeknights. It is chill, they have a pool table, and play good music (they played Oasis and I was sold). The crowd is the normal bar folks with some rockers sprinkled in. The bartender is a nice lady with a cute accent. --Any one who doesn't like Oasis can piss off.
author: Trevor D.

description: Although I've only been there a few times, they have a GREAT mohito and they have 18 year macallan scotch!  On certain nights they have games in the bar to involve all the clientele.
author: L M.

description: i stumbled into this bar during a bachlorette party and it was such a pleasant surprise.  chill crowd with a log cabin interior.  fun pool table in the back and a jukebox stocked with decent tunes.  they also have a fireplace with a cushions surrounding the hearth.  would love to go back in the winter and curl up next to the fire, if it's ever lit.
author: Sharlene C.

description: yay bacchus kirk!  this great little bar served as the site of the fabulous bday party we threw for our fave girl, and was the perfect backdrop for all of the amazing things that happened that night.  while i have a feeling the party changed the usual vibe of the place, the crowd was fun and friendly and the drinks hit the spot.  the fireplace was a nice touch, although the bar got a little hot as the evening went on.  but the set-up of the bar was great for chatting with groups, and there was room for dancing for when the mood struck.  and since it is so conveniently located to my friend's apartment, we will most definitely be regulars at this place.
author: ali l.

description: this place has really turned around since the days of doing my laundry and getting a bit tipsy. jukebox is good, just keep 'er spinning. the bartenders are nice and always check id's. you have to appreciate a bar the insists on checking id's.
author: carli m.

description: I live across the street from this place, yet you won't find me here often. The place does look pretty cool, has a cozy atmosphere, a pool table and friendly staff, but these are the only redeeming qualities. What weighs this place down are pricey drinks and, more than anything else, the douchy clientele. Not necessarily referring to the infrequents or the average type of people this place attracts, but the few weirdo regulars that are always there and always annoying to the point where I'd like to take it outside.
author: Patrick M.

description: Morrissey? Megadeath? You pick - they have a juke box with music that is so different yet all good.  Dogs - YES.  Strong drinks - YES.  Smoke room for my smoking friends - YES.  Slow service - YES - but for some reason I like it.  Go ahead and take your time. It all just works.
author: d l.

description:
i used to go to this place often.  i used to live down the street from this place.  i agree with Patrick M.'s review when it comes to the weirdo regulars.  there are a couple there that are just plain annoying.  i have found it is best to go there on a weekend morning until early afternoon.  i had a really annoying experience there one time.  let me tell you about it.
so i am there drinking, heavily, and playing pool and so on.  then a serious douchebag tweeker walks in to the bar and wants to play pool.  he's definitely flying high on something.  from the moment he starts playing he is annoying me.  he is lining up all of his shots like he has laser fingers.  he is not lining them up with his cue but with his fingers.  and it is taking him nearly 5 minutes to take any shot.  so i do what any rational human would do i yell at him to hurry the f*ck up.  very pleasantly of course.
that was all for a little bit until he followed me outside and started talking jibberish to me.  well badda boom bodda bing there were some punches thrown and they threw me out of the bar.  
i was livid; here i was had dropped nearly 60 bucks buying drinks for me and my friends.  i didn't throw the first punch, this guy didn't buy anything and they throw me out.  after that i decided i would never go back.  i tried to go back of course and the douche would not let me back in.  that was last year and i have been back a few times since but this bar has kind of lost it's appeal to me.
author: Anthony Y.

description: been a loyal patron since '88. ah, the good 'ol days. like so many, the bacchus has changed they have been able to maintain coolness. r.i.p. jerry and the rest of the old timers.
author: Jeff B.
